description: On March 17, the Swiss Canton of Fribourg published a recommendation to be aware of 'Fake news' being disseminated on social networks, directing the public to its official news outlet to find reliable information.
Swiss canton Zurich informs the population about frauds exploiting the corona situation on March 27 (eg phishing mails from WHO, wrong coronavirus maps, fake shops for medical products...).
On April 2, the Swiss Canton Ticino, more precisely the Cantonal police office, warns about scams and fraud related to coronavirus.
On March 4, 2020 the Swiss Canton of Neuchatel Departement of Education announced the cancellation of all overnight - school trips and school skicamps starting next week ( March 9) till April 30.
type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)
institution_status: Primary Schools allowed to open with conditions

description:
On March 13th, 2020 the Swiss Federal council announces that all in person teaching at schools, universities and training centers are banned until April 4th. Exams that have already been scheduled can be carried out if certain protective measures are taken. However, the cantons can offer childcare for elementary schools to prevent children from being looked after by their grandparents.
This (Art. 5 Covid 19 ordinance 2) comes into force on March 16, 6 am.
type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)
institution_status: Primary Schools allowed to open with conditions
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Education,Provincial/State Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Switzerland decided on national level to close all kindergartens as well as all private schools, schools for physically and mentally handicapped children, primary school and upper school (Primarschulen & Oberstufen) from the 16th of March to the 20th of April. The canton Aargau implements that policy and additionally also releases a policy only for the canton Aargau that the closed schools have to offer day care as long as the schools are closed from 08.00 a.m. to 12.00 p.m. and from 01:30 p.m. to 6 p.m.
type_sub_cat: Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
institution_status: Preschool or childcare facilities allowed to open with conditions

description: On 13th March 2020, the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel ordered the closure of all schools, professional training centers, high schools, universities, "hautes coles" (specialized higher education institutions) and extra-familial care centers (eg: day-care centers), from 16th March 2020 to 4th April 2020. A minimum extra-familial care service will be however provided on certain conditions to families who can't keep their children at home (conditions: parents work in healthcare, emergency or security services and have no other child care option).
type_sub_cat: Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
institution_status: Preschool or childcare facilities closed/locked down

description:
The authorities of the canton Schaffhausen announced on March 13th, 2020 that there will be no on-site teaching in the schools in the canton Schaffhausen, from March 16th onwards. There should be no on-site teaching until April 4th. The Schools should move to online teaching, the authorities said. 

Secondary schools and higher education institutions are allowed to go back to on-site teaching on June 8th, 2020.

description: Following the federal decision from April 29, 2020, to allow presence-based teaching from May 11 onwards, the Swiss canton of Appenzell Innerrhoden has decided to allow presence-based teaching in full class size from May 11 onwards. While primary and compulsory schools (age 4-15) open from May 11, secondary and high schools (Sek II) open on June 8 in full class size. All schools need to follow federal regulations on social distancing and hygiene. If classrooms can not guarantee a distance of two meters between each participant, rooms need to be changed.
type_sub_cat: Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
institution_status: Preschool or childcare facilities closed/locked down

Students in the Gymnasium St. Antonius will continue studying via an online platform. Since May 11, all "Volksschulen" (elementary schools), and since June 8, the Gymnasium St. Antonius, have reintroduced presence-based teaching.

description:
Switzerland "At an extraordinary meeting today, 16 March 2020, the  Federal Council took the decision to introduce more stringent measures to protect the public".
"The new Ordinance on Measures to fight the Coronavirus also clarifies the question of child day-care facilities. The cantons are required to ensure that childcare is provided for children who cannot be looked after privately. Child day-care facilities may only be closed if other suitable arrangements exist. This measure will apply for the time being until 19 April. School closures will also now apply until this date."
This ordinance comes into force March 17.
type_sub_cat: Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
institution_status: Preschool or childcare facilities allowed to open with conditions

description: On 13th March 2020, the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel ordered the closure of all schools, professional training centers, high schools, universities, "hautes coles" (specialized higher education institutions) and extra-familial care centers (eg: day-care centers), from 16th March 2020 to 4th April 2020. A minimum extra-familial care service will be however provided on certain conditions to families who can't keep their children at home (conditions: parents work in healthcare or security and have no other child care option). On 16th March 2020, this policy was extended to 19th April 2020 by the federal Ordinance 2 of 16th March 2020, which took over all cantonal measures.
type_sub_cat: Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
institution_status: Preschool or childcare facilities closed/locked down
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description:
On March 23, in Switzerland the Canton Jura announced that
- all schools (compulsory and post-compulsory) will remain closed till April 30, 2020. 
- Admission to childcare facilities is limited to children who cannot benefit from a private daycare solution.
Priority is given to the children of people mobilized in the fight against the coronavirus, and for children whose placement is ordered or recommended by the authorities or social services.

description: In Switzerland, the state council of the canton of Zurich decided at the 19th of march that the exams from the 25th of march will be moved to a later date because of the big numbers of candidates the health measures cant be met, thats why the oral exams and the creative aptitude tests will not take place.  This leads to adjustments of the admission procedure in middle schools and specialized middle school for the school year 2020/2021. For the admission, the result of the written examination will be decisive for pupils, according to the applicable admission regulations would have to take the oral exam. These pupils will be provisional accepted to the probationary period. The design aptitude tests for the K + S classes and the Liceo artisto will be exclusively based on the handed in documents of the candidates.
type_sub_cat: Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18)
institution_status: Secondary Schools allowed to open with conditions

description:
On April 23, 2020 Swiss Canton Geneva has extended the closure of all private and public schools and children day care facilities ( age 4 to 14) till May 11. Minimum daycare is provided for children (age 4-10) of families without any other option.
Childcare facilities for small children ( age 0-4) will start to gradually reopen after April 27. A new directive for these institutions is launched.

description:
On April 30 Ticino announced the reopening of compulsory schools as of May 11. However non-compulsory schools, i.e. high schools for children from 15-18 and higher education institutes, remain closed. 
Elementary school (age 6-12) reopen part-time (minimum of 4 half days or 2 full days) and reduced in number of students (maximum half of a section of 25 students). This also applies to kindergarten ( age 4-6), but attendance will be voluntary. As before emergency childcare is provided, but not extended.
For secondary schools, the return to class occurs fractionally. Each institution taking into account the number of its students and its particularities (transport, canteen etc.), will organize one partial presence of the classes in place for at least one day (or two half-days per week). Distance learning will be extended.
type_sub_cat: Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18)
institution_status: Secondary Schools closed/locked down

description:
On April 30, the Swiss canton of Obwalden announced that in accordance with federal guidelines, compulsory in-person education would resume with a hygiene concept on May 11. Restrictions include: Staff members must maintain social distancing (2m) from each other and students. Students from 5th grade and older are encouraged to practice social distancing outside the classroom, this does not apply to younger students. Hands must be washed upon entering school premises. Classrooms must be aired after every class, surfaces must be cleaned regularly. All school members are discouraged from sharing food, beverages, and dishes. All school members must be actively trained on these rules.

Written final exams take place normally, but without oral exams.

More tight restrictions apply to non-compulsory education, especially vocational training.
type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)
institution_status: Primary Schools allowed to open with conditions
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
On April 30, 2020 the Department of Education in Swiss canton of Basel - City the announced that as of May 11, 2020, lessons for children will begin in kindergarten ( age 4-5), primary school (age 6-12) and lower secondary level ( age 12-15) according to the usual lesson times and the regular timetable in their classes.
According to the requirements of the Federal Office of Health (BAG), the distance rules between teachers  and students must be observed as far as possible.This is not necessary between the students themselves. Children day care facilities ( age 0 to 12) will open as well, but group size remains limited to 10 children. Remote learning will go on for post-obligatory education.

institution_status: Preschool or childcare facilities allowed to open with conditions

description:
On May 1, 2020 in Switzerland Canton Fribourg announced that the pupils of the 1st and 2nd cycle ( age 4 to 12) will return to the compulsory schools on May 11th in half-classes, two days per weeks. Group A on Mondays and Thursdays,  group B on Tuesdays and Fridays. till May 25th.
For students of secondary I schools distance learning will continue. Private secondary schools may open according to their own order. Emergency childcare for school children will continue. Secondary II schools ( age 16 - 18 ) may resume in groups of 5 students.

The use of separating plexiglass barriers is recommended.

description: "At its meeting on April 29, 2020 the Swiss Federal Council decided to further ease the measures introduced to protect the population against the coronavirus. description:
"At its meeting on April 29, 2020 the Swiss Federal Council decided to further ease the measures. From Monday, May 11 primary and lower secondary schools ( age 4 to 15) will be able to recommence classroom teaching. The FOPH and the Swiss Conference of Cantonal Directors of Education have drawn up requirements for the precautionary measures to be taken in consultation with the Science Taskforce and other experts. The cantons and communes have until 11 May to make arrangements for implementing these measures, taking account of local circumstances in each case. Schools will be allowed to be flexible in their approach to classroom teaching. Cantons to decide how classes will be taught. "
Covid 19 ordinance 2, Art. 5:  If there is no face-to-face teaching, the cantons will provide appropriate childcare for pupils. Children's day-care centers and other care offers must comply with the recommendations of the FOPH regarding hygiene and social distance.
type_sub_cat: Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
institution_status: Preschool or childcare facilities allowed to open with conditions

description:
On May 1, 2020 in Switzerland Canton Fribourg announced that the pupils of the 1st and 2nd cycle ( age 4 to 12) will return to the compulsory schools on May 11th in half-classes, two days per weeks. Group A on Mondays and Thursdays,  group B on Tuesdays and Fridays. till May 25th.
For students of secondary I schools distance learning will continue. Private secondary schools may open according to their own order. Emergency childcare for school children will continue. Secondary II schools ( age 16 - 18 ) may resume in groups of 5 students. The policy was announced to last until the summer holidays, starting on July 6.
type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)
institution_status: Primary Schools allowed to open with conditions

description: On 13th March 2020, the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel ordered the closure of all schools, professional training centers, high schools, universities, "hautes coles" (specialized higher education institutions) and extra-familial care centers (eg: day-care centers), from 16th March 2020 to 4th April 2020. A minimum extra-familial care service will be however provided on certain conditions to families who can't keep their children at home (conditions: parents work in healthcare or security and have no other child care option). On 16th March 2020, this policy was extended to 19th April 2020 by the federal Ordinance 2 of 16th March 2020, which took over all cantonal measures. On 30th April 2020, the canton of Neuchtel announced that in-person classes would resume in half-classes ("demi-classe") on 11th May 2020 for cycles 1 and 2 of compulsory schooling (1st to 8th year of education), thus ending the original policy.
type_sub_cat: Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
institution_status: Preschool or childcare facilities closed/locked down
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

Conditions are the following: people within schools have to keep a distance of 2 meters at least apart from one another; classes can be separated into different groups depending on the number of students per classes and the number of square meters in each classroom. Exceptions can be made for vulnerable students and teachers, who will have the possibility to continue online classes.

Teachers who are part of a vulnerable population will continue distance teaching.

description:
At its meeting on May 27, 2020 the Swiss Federal Council decided that  the measures put in place to fight the new coronavirus will be extensively eased. Classroom teaching at upper secondary ( age 16 and above) and at vocational schools and at higher education institutions will be allowed to resume from June 8th. 
Under what form the teaching resumes is a matter for the cantons or the educational institutions.Teaching can be organised flexibly and distance-learning can still be used. All educational institutions must develop and implement a protection concept.The responsible cantonal authorities ensure that the relevant requirements are implemented within the framework protection concepts established by the FOPH.
type_sub_cat: Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18)
institution_status: Secondary Schools allowed to open with conditions
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Education,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

description:
On May 28, 2020 the Swiss Canton of Basel City announced that after the compulsory school (age 4-15) started classroom teaching on May 11, 2020, lessons will also start again at the vocational and upper secondary schools (age 15-18) from June 8, 2020. Social distancing (2m) must be maintained in the classroom. Depending on the spatial situation - there are different teaching models until summer break (June 26). At certain schools practically all students can attend face-to-face lessons, at others there is a mixture of face-to-face and distance learning.
Group size in childcare facilities is no longer restricted due to corona and school trips can resume as well.

description:
On May 26, 2020 the Departement of Education of the Swiss canton of Vaud presented its protection plan for the return of around 37,000 students and apprentices from Secondary II schools to class on June 8th ( age 16 and over) till summer break ( starting July 6th).
The spatial distance of 2 meters must be maintained between the students and between students and teachers.
The lessons take place in small groups, depending on the size of the rooms in square meters (1 person per 4 square meters).
Students will therefore come to school alternately every other day or every third day or respectively one week out of 2 or 3 for apprentices.
Homework is given for days without lessons. Only past year students who already received their title will not be required to return to class.
type_sub_cat: Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18)
institution_status: Secondary Schools allowed to open with conditions
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government

description:
On 30th April 2020, the Swiss canton of Neuchtel announced its plan for the reopening of classes (for compulsory school, see records 8429061 and 1859975) but all post-compulsory schools (equivalent of high school) remain closed until further notice. Universities are to remain closed as well due to the absence of announcements regarding the resumption of classes. On 28th May 2020, the canton announced that in-person classes would resume under conditions in post-compulsory schools on 8th June 2020, thus ending this policy.

NB: there was no information on resumption of classes for universities, but one can consider the closure of universities ended as well because most (if not all) university calendars end in late May.

description: On August 10, the Swiss Canton Ticino, announces the new measures for the re-opening of schools on August 31. In general, schools are foreseen to reopen with face to face classes. Masks will be optional for middle and post-compulsory students, for teachers, it will be optional during lessons and mandatory in the common areas. The common measures of hygiene and social distancing apply. In compulsory school, the distance of 1.5 meters between students is not indicated as necessary. The distance between the teacher and the students and between the adults present is important. In the post-compulsory school, where children are considered as adults, the distance must also be maintained between students. As for some disciplines such as physical education, there will be specific indications to avoid sports that involve frequent direct physical contact between students.

description: on February 28, 2020 the Swiss federal council declares a "special situation" (spezielle Lage) , the first step in the epidemics act, allowing the federal council to take over some competences from the cantonal level.

description: on march 11, 2020 the government of the Swiss Canton Ticino is declaring the state of emergency.
on March 13, 2020 in Switzerland the government of Canton Grisons declares  an 'extraordinary situation`(aussergewhnliche Lage).

On March 13 the Government  councilor of Canton Thurgau has announced state of an exceptional situation (Auergewhnliche Lage). 
In doing so, it hands over further competencies in the organizational and financial area to the management team (Fhrungsstab). The extraordinary situation in the canton of Thurgau currently has no further consequences for the population.
type_text: The Governemnt of Canton Thurgau has announced a state of extraordinary situation, which has no consequences for citizens, but hands over further competencies in the organizational and financial area to the management team (Fhrungsstab)

description: On March 13, the State Council of the Swiss Canton of Fribourg declared a State of Emergency, transferring the responsibility for handling the crisis to a 'Cantonal steering body'.
On March 15, 2020 in Switzerland Canton Basel-Landschaft has declared the State of Emergency.
On March 16, 2020 in Switzerland the council of Canton Vaud declares a situation of necessity within the territory of Canton Vaud according to Swiss Epidemics Act.
On March 16,2020 in Switzerland Canton Valais declares an 'extraordinary situation' (aussergewhliche Situation).
On March 16th, The Swiss Federal Council announces an "extraordinary situation" [ausserordentliche Lage] within their epidemic legislative procedure.
The Canton Zurich (Switzerland) declares an exceptional situation on March 16.
On March 16, 2020 the State Council of Swiss Canton of Geneva declares the state of emergency  (l'tat de ncessit).

On Monday, March 16, 2020 in Switzerland the government council of Canton Uri held an extraordinary meeting  and decided on immediate measures in connection with protection against the coronavirus. It has determined the extraordinary situation for the entire canton of Uri in accordance with Article 2 of the Law on Civil Protection in the canton of Uri.
(announced March 17)

In Switzerland, the canton Aargau declares at the 16th or March the state of emergency. This includes the ban of public and private events, closed shops, markets, restaurants, bars, museums, leisure facilities, libraries, cinemas, theatres, concert halls, gyms and swimming halls as well as shops where people cant keep enough distance like hairdressers and make up studios. Supermarkets, take-aways, company canteens, delivery services for food, pharmacies, gas stations, train stations, banks, post offices, hotels, car repair shops, public administration and social facilities will stay open will stay open as long as they fulfil the distance and hygiene regulations. Hospitals, clinics and doctors surgeries will stay open but not preform not urgent treatment. People with high risk of getting infected will be on payed leave. Day cares will only be closed if other appropriate care exists.
The cantonal authorities of Schaffhausen have declared the state of emergency on March 17th 2020. This policy is a reaction on the declaration of the state of emergency on the national level.
On March 17, 2020 in Switzerland the Government of Canton Jura launched a Declaration of Emergency (tat de ncessit) according to the Cantonal Constitution.

The cantonal authorities of Schaffhausen have declared the state of emergency on March 17th 2020. This policy is a reaction on the declaration of the state of emergency on the national level. The state of emergency has ended on June 19th 2020.

On 18th March 2020, the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel declared an "extraordinary situation" in the canton, which gave extraordinary powers to the State council in order to protect the population.

NB: This decision echoes and refers to the declaration of "extraordinary situation" by the Swiss federal government on 16th March 2020.

on March 27, 2020 the Swiss federal council defines a new regional limited situation of 'special threat' (besondere Gefhrdungslage) and issues an order ( refering to the Swiss Epidemics Act) to allow single cantons to take further measures on economic sectors in coordination with the federal council to fight the epidemie. This will apply backward after March 21,2020: ( to backward legalize Ticino policies).
On March 27, 2020 in Switzerland the State Council of Canton Ticino extended the State of Emergency for the entire territory of Ticino till April 19, 2020.
On April 15, 2020 in Switzerland Canton Ticino extended the State of Emergency for the entire territory of Ticino till May 31, 2020.

On 18th March 2020, the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel declared an "extraordinary situation" in the canton, which gave extraordinary powers to the State council in order to protect the population.
NB: This decision echoes and refers to the declaration of "extraordinary situation" by the Swiss federal government on 16th March 2020.
 
On 5th May 2020, the Grand Council of the Canton of Neuchtel reaffirmed the "extraordinary situation" and extended it to 26th May 2020.
On May 20 the Swiss Canton Ticino extended the state of emergency for the entire territory of Ticino to June 30.
On May 26, 2020 Swiss Canton Basel-Landschaft announced that as of May 31, 2020, midnight, the government council is lifting the State of Emergency for the Canton of Basel-Landschaft.
On June 4, 2020 in Switzerland the Government of Canton Jura announced the end of the State of Emergency (tat de ncessit) as of June 6, 2020.

On Monday, March 16, 2020 in Switzerland the government council of Canton Uri held an extraordinary meeting  and decided on immediate measures in connection with protection against the coronavirus. It has determined the extraordinary situation for the entire canton of Uri in accordance with Article 2 of the Law on Civil Protection in the canton of Uri.
(announced March 17)
Swiss canton Valais declares on June 16, that the pandemic is not an exceptional situation anymore but now a special one (besondere Lage).
The Swiss Federal Council announces an "extraordinary situation" [ausserordentliche Lage] within their epidemic legislative procedure.

description: On March 16,2020 in Switzerland Canton Valais declares an 'extraordinary situation' (aussergewhliche Situation). The policy ends on June 19.
On June 15, the Swiss Canton Grisons announces the end of the "extraordinary situation"(aussergewhnliche Lage) as of June 19. This is in line with the respective federal decision.

On March 13 the Government  councilor of Canton Thurgau has announced state of an exceptional situation (Auergewhnliche Lage). 
In doing so, it hands over further competencies in the organizational and financial area to the management team (Fhrungsstab). The extraordinary situation in the canton of Thurgau currently has no further consequences for the population. On June 16 the Government of Canton Thurgau has announced that State of Emergency will finish on June 19.
type_text: The Governemnt of Canton Thurgau has announced a state of extraordinary situation, which has no consequences for citizens, but hands over further competencies in the organizational and financial area to the management team (Fhrungsstab)

description:
The swiss federal council decided that from the 11th of March 2020 on Switzerland cross-border travelling from Italy to Switzerland will be limited to only a few borders crossings. The small border crossings will be closed and the border traffic will be channeled to the big border crossings. 

Following the closed border crossings -> alternative open border crossings

Pedrinate -> Chiasso strada (Ponte Chiasso)
Ponte Faloppia -> Novazzano Brusata (Bizzarone) or Chiasso strada
Novazzano Marcetto -> Novazzano Brusata (Bizzarone) or Chiasso strada
San Pietro di Stabio -> Stabio Gaggiolo
Ligornetto Cantinetta -> Stabio Gaggiolo
Arzo -> Stabio Gaggiolo or Brusino Arsizio
Ponte Cremenaga -> Fornasette or Ponte Tresa
Cassinone -> Fornasette
Indemini -> Dirinella (Zenna)
type_sub_cat: Other External Border Restriction
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description: On March 13th 2020, the Swiss Federal Council re-opens federal border checks including Schengen checks at the Italian border designed to limit incoming traffic from Italy to Switzerland. Only Swiss citizens, people with a residence permit in Switzerland, people who only travel through Switzerland, and people who have to travel to Switzerland for professional reasons are allowed to enter from Italy. Transit and goods traffic are still allowed. Finally, people in a situation of absolute necessity may also enter from Italy.

Only Swiss citizens, people with a residence permit in Switzerland and people who have to travel to Switzerland for professional reasons are allowed to enter Italy. Transit and goods traffic are also allowed. Finally, people in a situation of absolute necessity may also enter from Italy.

description: On March 11, Ticino closes 9 minor mountain passes on the Italian border, i.e. Pedrinate, Ponte Faloppia, Novazzano Marcetto, San Pietro di Stabio, Ligornetto Cantinetta, Arzo, Ponte Cremenaga, Cassinone, Indemini. On March 16 5 other minor mountain passes were added to the temporary closure, namely Arogno, Brusino, Pizzamiglio, Camedo e Fornasette.

description: From the 17th of March onwards, the Swiss Federal Council extends the travel ban introduced to Italy to France, Austria and Germany. Entrance remains allowed for Swiss citizens, people with a residence permit in Switzerland, people traveling through Switzerland, and people who have to travel to Switzerland for professional reasons. Transit and goods traffic are also allowed. Finally, people in a situation of absolute necessity may also enter from these countries.

description: In Switzerland the swiss federal council stated that additional to the originally people that were banned from entering from Italy, Germany, France and Austria from the 19th of March on also people from Spain and non EU/ EFTA countries are banned from entering Switzerland. Additional to that, the exceptions of why a person is allowed to enter Switzerland got upgraded to another one that says that also necessary health workers are allowed to enter.

description:
In Switzerland the swiss federal council decided that from the 19th of march on additionalyl to the countries from where citizens are already not allowed to travel to Switzerland (Italy, Germany, Austria, France) also citizens from Spain and all non EU/ EFTA are not allowed to enter Switzerland anymore besides with a few exceptions. 
Also the swiss federal state decided that additional to the already existing exceptions of why people would be allowed to enter Switzerland also necessary health workers will be allowed to enter.

description:
In Switzerland, additional to the channelling of the border traffic from Italy the swiss federal council decided that from the 19th of march on also flights will be included in these restrictions and that also other countries like Germany, Austria, Spain and France will be included into the channeling of border traffic.

Flights from these countries will be channeled to the airports: Zrich-Kloten, Genf-Cointrin und Basel-Mulhouse.
type_sub_cat: Other External Border Restriction
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description:
In Switzerland, additional to the channelling of the border traffic from Italy the swiss federal council decided that from the 19th of march on also flights will be included in these restrictions and that also other countries like Germany, Austria, Spain and France will be included into the channeling of border traffic.

Flights from these countries will be channeled to the airports: Zrich-Kloten, Genf-Cointrin und Basel-Mulhouse. 

Also the EJPD is from the 19th of march on allowed to decide about restrictions in road traffic, traffic by ship, airplanes, trains can after consulting with the EDI, the UVEK, the EDI and the EDA 
The EJPD can also channel movement of travellers to certain border crossings, airports, harbours

description: In Switzerland the swiss federal council decided to change the entry restrictions. At the 25th of March 2020 the policy got implemented that not like before only flights from Italy, Germany, France and Austria will be channeled to the airpots Zrich-Kloten, Genf-Cointrin und Basel-Mulhouse but that all international flights will be now channeled to these airports
type_sub_cat: Other External Border Restriction
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description: On March 18, the Federal Council declares that the issuance and authorization of Schengen as well as national visas from Germany, France, Italy, Austria, Spain and all non-Schengen states is discontinued. This does not apply to applications from people in a situation of extreme necessity or from specialists in the health sector.
type_sub_cat: Visa restrictions (e.g. suspend issuance of visa)

description: In Switzerland the swiss federal council decided that from the 25st of March on the frontier crossing ban would be changed. Instead of forbidding people from Spain, Germany, Austria and Italy and countries that are not part of the Schengen agreement it changed so nobody is allowed to enter Switzerland from countries in the Schengen agreement and all other countries. Only people from Liechtenstein were allowed to enter
type_sub_cat: Other External Border Restriction
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description: The Swiss Federal Council extends entry restrictions/border checks to include all Schengen states and non-Schengen states except for the principality of Lichtenstein on March 25th 2020. The previous policy only applied to entrants from Italy, France, Germany and Austria.

description: On March 18, the Swiss Federal Council extends the external border checks introduced to Germany, Austria, Italy and France to foreign travelers from Spain and all non-Schengen states. Entrance remains allowed for Swiss citizens, people with a residence permit in Switzerland, people traveling through Switzerland, and people who have to travel to Switzerland for professional reasons as well as supporting health care workers. Transit and goods traffic are also allowed. Finally, people in a situation of absolute necessity may also enter from these countries.

description: From April 2 onwards, the Swiss federal costoms administration builds up so-called "Green Lanes" at some crossings of the Swiss border to optimize and speed up the import of important goods for the maintenance of the national economic supply as well as the enterance of priority professional groups, especially those working in the health sector.
type_sub_cat: Other External Border Restriction
target_geog_level: All countries
compliance: Mandatory (Other; please list other enforcement mechanisms in the text entry)
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
In Switzerland the swiss federal council decided that from the 2nd of April 2020 on customs (Die Eidgenssische Zollverwaltung (EZV)) is allowed to close small border crossings independently if needed. The closure will be immediately reported to the EJPD, UVEK and the EDA. Costumes will mark closed borders and publishes based in this data a list of open borders in their website.

Also from the 2nd of April 2020 on customs will decide which streets for prior traffic (green lanes) will be kept to keep the flow of essential goods up that the state supply can be maintained. The same applies to essential workers, especially people working in health care. Customs will publish the list of the green lanes and which conditions are necessary to use them on their website
type_sub_cat: Other External Border Restriction
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description:

The swiss federal council decided that from the 2nd of April on the entry with a cross-border commuter permit (Grenzgngerbewilligung) based on passage 1 letter b to Switzerland is only permitted for occupational reasons.
type_sub_cat: Other External Border Restriction
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description: From April 17 onwards, the Swiss federal council is putting a fine of CHF 100 on border crossings of Swiss residents for shopping tourism in France, Italy, Liechtenstein, Austria, and Germany to prevent the obstruction of the work of the border control authority.

target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
In Switzerland the swiss federal council decided that from the 17th April 2020 on the State Secretariat for Migration passes the necessary instructions to judge who has legitimate reasons to enter Switzerland. 

Also from the 17th of April on it is forbidden to import goods from all neighbouring countries besides Liechtenstein if the reason for travelling to a neighbouring country was in the first place to buy and then import goods to Switzerland
type_sub_cat: Other External Border Restriction
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description:
Switzerland, Geneva- May 10, the Geneva State Council authorizes the opening of the border on May 11 for students and accompanying persons (i.e. bus drivers) that live in France so that they can attend schools when reopened. 

Original: Suite  la demande du Conseil dEtat genevois, les autorits fdrales autorisent les coliers domicilis en France voisine ainsi que les personnes qui les accompagnent  y compris les chauffeurs de bus scolaires   franchir la frontire suisse ds la reprise de la scolarit obligatoire, le 11 mai 2020
type_sub_cat: Other External Border Restriction
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description: On May 11, the Swiss Federal Council relaxes the external border checks introduced to foreign travelers from all states except for Liechtenstein for foreign workers, family reunifications and students from France. Entrance remains allowed for Swiss citizens, people with a residence permit in Switzerland, family reunifications, students from France, people traveling through Switzerland, and people who have to travel to Switzerland for professional reasons as well as supporting health care workers. Foreign workers who applied for short-term employment and whose professional activity is necessary for the national well-being are allowed to enter Switzerland if either their application was submitted to the responsible cantonal authority before the border restrictions enacted on 25 March 2020 (European or EFTA states) or their application was approved prior to March 19 2020 but the border crossing was impossible because of the restriction on the approval of Visa or residence permits (non European/EFTA states). Transit and goods traffic are also allowed. Finally, people in a situation of absolute necessity may also enter.

description:
In Switzerland the swiss federal council decided that from the 11th of march on that:
Immigrants that are not covered by the FZA or the agreement from the 4th of January 1960 about the formation of the EFTA-agreement do have to fulfil the additional entry fulfilments.
The responsible authorities are allowed to do risk-based controls 
Permission for immigrants that are entitled to free movement. Immigrants that are covered by the FZA or the EFTA, want to work in Switzerland for a short time are allowed to enter if:
-If the permit is in the interest of the public, especially in economic state supply 
-For family reunification 
-If the request for employment got handed in at the correct cantonal office before the 25th of march 2020 or if there was already a contract of employment with a swiss company 
-If the request for short term cross-border service is in line with the notification procedure and the service agreement was signed before the 25th of march 2020 
Immigrants that are not covered by the FZA and EFTA agreement are allowed to enter Switzerland if:
-They are in a situation of necessity or if they are health workers
-they got an entry permit before the 19th or march 2020 but the entry permit, visa, or a  residence permit that couldnt get certificated because of the current COVID-19 measures
-if the request of the employer got handed in before the 19th of march 2020. 
the migration of family members of swiss citizens based on article 42 AIG3
type_sub_cat: Other External Border Restriction
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description: In an agreement of May 15, 2020 with Germany and Austria, the Swiss Federal Department of Justice and Police allows people who wish to visit their partners or relatives or participate in important family events to cross the Swiss border using a self-declaration form. The same applies to owners of properties and gardens used by themselves as well as of agricultural, hunting or forestry land. Persons who have to care for animals may also enter.
type_sub_cat: Other External Border Restriction
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On March 28th of May 2020, the Swiss Federal Council re-opens the federal border to the Schengen countries (the border to Liechtenstein was never closed). All other countries besides the Schengen countries are still prohibited to enter Switzerland.
type_sub_cat: Other External Border Restriction
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description: On June 8, 2020 the Swiss Federal Council relaxes the external border checks introduced to foreign travelers from all states except for Liechtenstein for partners of Swiss residents and foreigners in education and training. Entrance remains allowed for Swiss citizens, people with a residence permit in Switzerland, family reunifications, partners of Swiss residents (e.g. to prepare for marriage), students from France, people traveling through Switzerland, and people who have to travel to Switzerland for professional reasons such as foreigns attending education and training >90 days as well as supporting health care workers. Foreign workers who applied for short-term employment and whose professional activity is necessary for the national well-being are allowed to enter Switzerland if either their application was submitted to the responsible cantonal authority before the border restrictions enacted on 25 March 2020 (European or EFTA states) or their application was approved prior to March 19 2020 but the border crossing was impossible because of the restriction on the approval of Visa or residence permits (non European/EFTA states). Transit and goods traffic are also allowed. Finally, people in a situation of absolute necessity may also enter.

description:
On July 1st, 2020 the Swiss Federal Council decided that from July 6th on all persons who enter Switzerland and who have been in a high risk Sars-CoV-2 country/ area within the last 14 days have to quarantine for 10 days (at home or in another appropiate accommodation). They have to report themselves within 2 days to the responsible cantonal authorities.Persons who have to go into quarantine are not entitled to loss of earnings compensation. Non - compliance can be fined.
Excepted are persons 
a. who professionally transport people or goods across borders
b. whose activity is absolutely necessary for maintaining the functionality of the health system or public security or international institutions
c. who have stayed in a risk country in the course of their professional activity in companies involved in rail, bus, ship or air transport 
d. who have to travel to Switzerland daily or up to 5 days for occupational or medical necessities
e. who have been less than 24h in a risk country (transit passengers)
f. who just pass through Switzerland.
The FOPH has a list of the countries concerned, which it updates regularly: Argentina, Armenia, Azerbaijan, Bahrain, Belarus, Bolivia, Brazil, Chile, Dominican republic, Honduras, Iraq, Israel, Cabo Verde, Qatar, Colombia, Kosovo, Kuwait, Moldova, North Macedonia, Oman, Panama, Peru, Russia, Saudi Arabia, Sweden, Serbia, South Africa, Turks- and Caicos islands (UK), USA
type_sub_cat: Other External Border Restriction
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings
compliance: Mandatory with Fines,Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Foreign Affairs,Ministry/Department of Justice,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Police

description:
The list of considered risk countries was updated on August 8, 2020 by the Swiss FOPH. As before all persons entering Switzerland coming from a risk country have to quarantine for 10 days, a negative test result does not exempt from the mandatory quarantine requirement. They have to report to the cantonal authorities that carry out spot checks. Exempted are transport professionals, transit passengers, cross border commuter, professionals needed in health system, public security, in some international institutions.

description:
The list of considered risk countries was updated on August 20, 2020 by the Swiss FOPH. As before all persons entering Switzerland coming from a risk country have to quarantine for 10 days, a negative test result does not exempt from the mandatory quarantine requirement. Quarantined persons do not get loss of earnings compensation, but exempted they could not know in advance that their travel destination will be a risk area. They have to report to the cantonal authorities that carry out spot checks. Exempted are transport professionals, transit passengers, cross border commuter, professionals needed in health system, public security, in some international institutions.

description: On Sept 11, the Swiss Federal Council decided on the quarantine rules after Sept 14 for persons entering Switzerland: only those regions of neighbouring countries with a high infection rate will be added to the list of risk countries, not the whole country. Border regions may be exempted. As before all persons entering Switzerland having stayed in a risk country within the last 10 ! days have to quarantine for 10 days, a negative test result does not exempt from the mandatory quarantine requirement. Quarantined persons do not get loss of earnings compensation,(except change of list after departure).They have to report to the cantonal authorities that can adjust the duration of the quarantine and carry out spot checks. Starting Sept. 14  professionals re-entering after participating in an event complying with a protection concept; e.g. sports competition or cultural event or a specialist congress are exempted and as before diplomats, transport professionals, transit passengers, cross border commuter, professionals needed in health system, public security, in some international institutions. list of French risk areas as of September 14h: Centre-Val de Loire, Corse, Hauts-de-France, le de France, Normandie, Nouvelle-Aquitaine, Occitanie, Pays de la Loire, Provence-Alpes-Cte d'Azur and following overseas areas: French Guyana, Guadeloupe, La Runion, Martinique, Mayotte
type_sub_cat: Other External Border Restriction
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description:
On Sept 11, the Swiss Federal Council decided on the new list of risk countries as of Sept.14. All persons entering Switzerland having stayed in a risk country within the last 10 ! days have to quarantine for 10 days, a negative test result does not exempt from the quarantine requirement. There is no loss of earnings compensation (except change of list after departure). Travelers have to report to the cantonal authorities that can adjust the duration of the quarantine and carry out spot checks. Starting Sept.14  professionals re-entering after participating in an event like sports competition or cultural event or a specialist congress are exempted and as before diplomats, transport professionals, transit passengers, cross border commuter, professionals needed in health system, public security, in some international institutions.

description: Switzerland January 27, Ticino invites citizens who travelled to China in the last 14 days and who demonstrate respiratory problems and/or fever to avoid presenting themselves in health facilities but to contact their family doctor only by telephone, or the Rescue Center 144 or the emergency medical service.

Switzerland: From January 27, 2020, doctors and laboratories will have to report cases of suspected corona infection to the cantons and the federal government within two hours, as FOPH media spokesman Jonas Montani confirmed in a report by "Sonntagsblick" to the Keystone-SDA news agency.

On its press conference on February 25, 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Health informed about the first person in Switzerland confirmed as being infected with the new coronavirus 2019-nCoV. People in close contact with the individual are being notified and placed in quarantine and their condition will be monitored over the next 14 days. On its webside ( February 16) the FOPH informed:" Should there be cases, the sick people would be isolated. Close Contact persons would have to be in quarantine for two weeks." On the webside for health professionals ( Feb 17) the term close contact is specified:
Contact from less than 2 meters and for more than 15 minutes. People who live in the same household. Care or medical examination without protective gear. Direct contact with body fluids. The cantonal departements of Health (Kantonsarzt) are responsible for tracing contact persons and monitoring their condition.
The Swiss Canton Grisons implements contact tracing with the first confirmed cases on February 27. It is not announced as official policy but since that moment systematically used and implemented.

On February 28th, the Jura canton in Switzerland called onto individuals with flu-like symptoms and having visited risk regions (China, Iran, South Korea, Singapore and the Lombardy, Piedmont, Veneto regions of Italy) to contact their doctor and/or the hotline provided by the government. It warned against calling and going to the Emergency Services of the Jura hospitals.
Since the first case was confirmed in Canton Zug on 3 March, contact tracing has been a fundamental part of the control measures. This will be a key strategy for the future, too.
Since the first case was confirmed in Canton Zug on 3 March, contact tracing has been a fundamental part of the control measures. This will be a key strategy for the future, too.

From 13th March 2020 on, the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel has been monitoring the health of patients suspected of Covid-19 if they were sent back home by the coronavirus triage centers. The centers' personnel regularly monitors the evolution of the symptoms of each individual through phone calls.

NB: as a reminder, the triage centers decide whether suspect patients should be sent to the hospital or back home, and if they should get tested or not.

On March 27th, 2020, it was announced that the cantons of Appenzell Innerrhoden and Appenzell Ausserrhoden, Switzerland, have established a new medical hotline to use by people who show symptoms of Covid-19 and who wish to be tested in testing facilities in the two cantons.

description: The canton of Appenzell Innerrhoden, Switzerland, has announced that starting from March 28th, 2020, there will be a new test facility for suspected Covid-19 cases placed in front of the Hospital Appenzell which will determine whether patients are to be hospitalized or not.
The Canton of Zug is using contact tracing of COVID-19 positive patients and regular checkups with individuals self-isolating with symptoms on March 31st 2020 to map the spread of the virus.

description: The canton Zurich (Switzerland) starts a "society monitoring Covid-19" process on March 31.

Switzerland, Geneva--The canton of Geneva, in relationship with the Directorate of General Health, announced April 1 that they have developed at 3 tier patient contact and monitoring system. The three-part system is comprised of CoviCall, CoviCheck, and CoviCare. 

CoviCall is for symptomatic individuals to get direction on whether to stay home, go see a doctor, go to a sampling/monitoring site, or go to the hospital.
CoviCheck centralizes all the positive results transmitted by the laboratories.
CoviCare is an outpatient monitoring network for suspected and confirmed cases.

description: Swiss Federal Health Authority releases guidelines for healthcare workers, including protective wear necessary and protocol for workers experiencing flu-like symptoms on April 2nd 2020.

description: On 8 April, the canton of Bern, Switzerland announces the development of a COVID-19 symptoms tracker app.

On 27th April 2020, the Swiss canton of Neuchtel decided to start contact tracing people who tested positive for Covid-19. Cantonal authorities will contact people who tested positive and identify potential contacts who could be at risk. This policy is supervised by the cantonal doctor and it will be implemented from 29th April 2020 on. The police will participate in this contact tracing scheme.

description: Swiss canton of St. Gallen resumed contact tracing on May 4, 2020 after it was abandoned earlier due to high levels of infections.
The canton Schaffhausen in Switzerland applies contact tracing again to contact person who are tested positive on Covid-19. This policy was announced on May 7th 2020 and starts the same day.

description: On May 7, the Swiss Canton of Fribourg started using a tracking system by the WHO in order to trace and monitor the contacts of persons with a positive COVID-19 test result. These persons will then be notified and be checked upon after 5-10 days. The estimate expects approximately 8 contact persons per tested individual and has a capacity of 10 persons to be tracked per day.
On May 10 the Government of Thurgau following the federal decision has announced, that Canton Thurgau started the tests on contact tracing possibilities and want to establish long-term solution.

In Switzerland, the canton Aargau will launch a contact tracing centre on May 11 for the accompaniment and care of people in self-isolation and self-quarantine. The infected people and their closest contest have to stay home and will be briefed, taken care of and supervised by the contact tracing centre.
The Swiss canton Zurich expands contact tracing: From May 11, a new Contact,tracing team with 25 people starts work.

The Cantonal Medical Service of the Canton of Aargau offers a comprehensive service package to people who have recently become infected with COVID-19. These people will be contacted, advised and instructed individually. This service is provided by a new competence and coordination center of the cantonal medical service, the CONTI.

The exchange of information and data takes place primarily by telephone. Patients and healthcare institutions such as doctors or test laboratories can also enter their data electronically using an appropriate secure web form

Switzerland, the canton Glarus uses contact tracing again from May 11, 2020 onwards. With the contact tracing it will be possible to track persons who were in contact with a infectious person, the cantonal authorities.

In Switzerland, in the canton Aargau the Cantonal Medical Service of Aargau offers from the 11th of May on a comprehensive service package to people who have recently become infected with COVID-19. These people will be contacted, advised and instructed individually. This service is provided by a new competence and coordination center of the cantonal medical service, the CONTI.

The exchange of information and data takes place primarily by telephone. Patients and healthcare institutions such as doctors or test laboratories can also enter their data electronically using an appropriate secure web form

As announced on May 11, the Swiss canton of Solothurn will resume contact tracing for all known cases of COVID-19. For this purpose, authorities have purchased a special software, as well as deployed a team of 5 people, with 10 more available if needed.
type_sub_cat: Who a person has come into contact with over time

description:
On May 11, the Swiss Canton Grisons announces that a team from the Health Department, supported by medical professionals and members of civil protection, resumed work on contact tracing. The aim is to interrupt the chain of infection by recording the sick and their contact persons and putting them in isolation (sick) or quarantine (contact). The COVID Care Team of the Graubnden Health Department accompanies the affected people during this time. 

The Swiss Canton Grisons never officially announced contact tracing as policy. However, since the first confirmed cases, it was systematically implemented and used. After around two weeks this was not possible anymore and the "extraordinary" situation and respective measures were implemented on March 13.

description:
On May 8, 2020 the Swiss Federal Council announced to issue a temporary ordinance (amended May 14) for the pilot phase of a mobile application (proximity tracing app) that informs its users when they have been around infected people for too long. 
The app is expected to be tested by employees of the Swiss Federal Institutes of Technology in Lausanne and Zurich, by members of the armed forces and employees of hospitals as well as the federal and cantonal administrations. 
The parliament decided this week (May 5) that a legal basis must be created before the launch of the App. To this end, the Federal Council will amend the Epidemics Act accordingly and submit an urgent message to be adopted by parliament
The app is designed to help break chains of infection. With the app, potentially infected people can be warned at an early stage and the spread of the virus can be contained without compromising their privacy. Use of the app is voluntary. No personal data or location details of the app users are used. All data in the app are continuously deleted after 21 days. The app should only be used in the containment phase.
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Justice,Military,Provincial/State Government

description: Valais (Switzerland) announces on May 14, that 4 people are conducting 7 to 10 contact tracing investigations a day. If necessary, the personal capacity can be increased to 20 people.

At its meeting on June 24th, 2020 the Swiss Federal Council adopted the Ordinance on the Proximity Tracing System for the Coronavirus. 
This means that the SwissCovid app can be used throughout Switzerland from June 25th.
The Federal Council recommends that the public use the app, which complements classic contact tracing. 
If an app user has been in close contact with one or more infected individuals, they receive a message telling them that they may be infected with the new coronavirus. They are also notified of the day on which the contact took place along with details of the FOPH Infoline that they can call free of charge to obtain advice.
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Justice

description:
In Switzerland the state of emergency ended at the 19th of June, since then the the crisis management is carried out by the the cantonal medical service responsible in accordance with the Epidemics Act or the Department of Health and Social Affairs. They will adopt and implement the cantonal instructions and measures necessary to prevent further virus spread. As a first step, the canton of Aargau will introduce an ID for bar and club visits from Friday, July 3, 2020, 6 p.m.
For this purpose, the canton of Aargau is introducing an ID requirement for visits to bars and clubs. The general decree will come into effect on Friday, July 3, 2020, at 6 p.m.
The identification requirement applies to bar and club businesses. Restoration companies with a bar area and few standing places are excluded. The identification requirement ensures that identity is verified by obliging bar and club operators to compare the entries with a reliable official ID (passport, identity card or driver's license) when maintaining the presence list.
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: From July 6, the Swiss Canton of Fribourg is requiring all arriving passengers from listed 'risk areas' to register with the cantonal authorities within 2 days from the arrival in order to monitor the compliance with the federal quarantine requirements.
target_geog_level: One or more regional groupings

description: In accordance with federal guidelines, the Swiss canton of Glarus imposed contact tracing requirements upon establishments (and events) such as restaurants, clubs, and bars, effective from July 20. These rules apply if no social distancing (min. 1.5m distance or masks) can be maintained. Establishments must collect contact information from every single guest and verify their accuracy (by means such as ID checks or calls to provided phone numbers), as well as store them electronically, ordered by dates. Data must be provided to cantonal health authorities within 2 hours upon request, and a contact person must be available for this purpose daily between 8 AM and 8 PM. Violations on purpose are subject to fines up to 10,000 CHF (up to 5000 CHF for violations by negligence).
type_sub_cat: Who a person has come into contact with over time
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Switzerland, Geneva--The Department of Security, Employment and Health (DSES), the Grand Conseil de la nuit and the company 2GIK Srl have announced the deployment of an app that "allows the cantonal doctor's service to obtain, in the event of a proven COVID-19 case, the list of people in contact with the patient, to warn them of possible contamination and to inform them of the measures to be taken." The app has been active since June 20 with certain venues, but following July 23 the app will be extended to all members of the Grand conseil de la nuit.

description: On 13th March 2020, the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel created 7 triage centers to sort suspect patients depending on the seriousness of their symptoms, and decide whether or not they should get tested. Based on several health checks conducted at the centers (fever checks, blood pressure, oxygen saturation tests...), patients are either sent to the hospital or back home. An 8th center managed by Mdecins du Monde has also been created to welcome undocumented immigrants and asylum seekers. A telephone line has been opened to book appointments at the centers. This policy overall aims at relieving the congestion in hospitals.
type_sub_cat: Temporary Medical Centers

description:
In Switzerland, the state council of the canton Zurich decided that from the 1st of April on additional health workers have to be hired because the outbreak of COVID-19 shows that the cantonal medical service is only able to handle smaller, local exposures but it is not set up for large, nationwide events.
The detailed list is:

-	1.0 positions senior physician, (wage class 22) 
-	1.8 positions Research Associate, (wage class 20) 
-	0.5 positions as an assistant doctor, (wage class 19) 
-	1.0 position administrative secretary, (wage class 12) 

This is a total job increase of 4.3
type_sub_cat: Doctors

description: In Switzerland, the state council of the canton Zurich decided that the cantonal pharmacy of Zurich is authorized to perform the service contract with Post CH AG. This is based on the fact that the current measures are not suitable for the continuous operation with its expected handling volumes and frequencies of more than 100 orders per day. Therefore, to provide the needed supply to around 6000 health care institutions (hospitals, medical practices etc.) in the canton of Zurich with protective material it is necessary to find as fast as possible a new warehouse and delivery logistics with an external logistics service provider being constructed
type_sub_cat: Unspecified Health Materials

description: In Switzerland, in the canton Zurich the medical association organizes on behalf of the health department of the Canton of Zurich (AGZ) the medical emergency service. It operates to do so with its subsidiary AGZ Support AG through the canton and the municipalities financed triage centre, which can be reached 24/7 via the emergency number 0800 33 66 55 is. This triage centre comes to ensure orderly care and triage of patients in the event of a pandemic and plays an important role for the greatest possible relief of the emergency departments of hospitals because it is the first point of contact for the residents when symptoms of COVID-19 appear. The triage centre is located in Zurich Oerlikon. It is set up to deal with a high load of calls through 12 additional external employees that answer these calls in home office. To be prepared for the worst case scenario of a severely restricted accessibility of the triage centre for the employees or a larger amount of sick employees additional 25 home office jobs will be created.
type_sub_cat: Other Health Infrastructure
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On March 27th, 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Health announced that with the help of Swisscoms analyses and visualisations, it is assessing whether the ban on gathering of more than five people in public ( by the Federal Council as of March 21st) is being respected. At no point location data from Swisscom are provided, merely analyses and visualisations. The data on which the analyses are based are anonymised and aggregated. It is not possible to make inferences about specific individuals. As soon as COVID-19 Ordinance 2 is abrogated, the Federal Office will not be provided with any further analyses.
type_sub_cat: Other Health Materials

description:
In Switzerland, the canton Aargau decided at the 1st of April that from the 2nd of April on the hospitals are exempted from certain regulations within the scope of fulfilling the special regulation (SonderV 20-1).

To authorize the hospitals for treatment regardless of the hospital list  8 para. 3 of the ordinance on the hospital list about the barriers and the spectrum of the service orders placed on the hospital list is suspended
Irrespective of the performance mandate, hospitals are authorized to treat patients within their medical area of competence. 
Treatments that are performed outside an assigned performance mandate and within the medical competence area are to be billed based on the Aargau tariff specified by the Department of Health and Social Affairs (DGS) in a specific case. The approved Aargau tariff for early rehabilitation is to be applied for the convalescence departments to be created by rehabilitation clinics.
Based on Section 7 (4) of the hospital list, the Department of Health and Social Affairs can also issue hospitals that do not fulfill the requirements of Section 2 (2) of the hospital list as well as the procedure, the documents and the procedure in accordance with Section 35 hospital list. 

To authorize inpatient care facilities to create bed capacity  13 para. 1 letter b and para. 2 of the Nursing Ordinance (PflV) is suspended.
The  4 para. 2 letter b of the Care Act (PflG), the guideline value for the proof of need is suspended.
type_sub_cat: Hospitals

description:
On march 31,2020 in Switzerland the Government of Canton Jura announced that three consultation centers for patients contaminated with coronavirus or likely to be will be operational from Thursday, April 2, 2020.
These three centers will be opened in Saignelgier, in Delmont and in Alle, respectively one point of care per district.

description: In Switzerland, the canton Aargau the Department of health and social affairs decided that from the 6th of April on the empty asylum seekers home at the maintenance area Frick that got closed will be used as an isolation ward for maximum 50 people. The cantonal social service, the Securitas AG, medical staff and civil defence will be in action and offer support. People with light symptoms or suspected cases will be accommodated there. Security and meals will be warranted.

description: The canton of Bern, Switzerland, has increased its capacity of hospital beds by 3,400 to prepare for COVID19 infections.
type_sub_cat: Other Health Materials

description: On 13th March 2020, the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel created 7 triage centers to sort suspect patients depending on the seriousness of their symptoms, and decide whether or not they should get tested. Based on several health checks conducted at the centers (fever checks, blood pressure, oxygen saturation tests...), patients are either sent to the hospital or back home. An 8th center managed by Mdecins du Monde has also been created to welcome undocumented immigrants and asylum seekers. A telephone line has been opened to book appointments at the centers. This policy overall aims at relieving the congestion in hospitals. On 15th April 2020, the canton of Neuchtel reduced the number of triage centers from 8 to 5 in order to match the demand and the resources.
type_sub_cat: Temporary Medical Centers

description:
In Switzerland, the canton Aargau the Federal Department of Home Affairs decided that from the 16th of April on the daily flat rate in convalescence departments in the rehabilitation clinics for covid-19 is CHF 913.

The canton Aargau offers people with low income a premium reduction for their health insurance premiums
If their financial situation gets worse there will be the possibility for more than 6 months to get an extraordinary adjustment for their premium reduction. This would be the case if the income decreased by at least 20%. Also, the senior civil servant decided that the waiting period of 6 months for the premium reduction will be abrogated.

For all persons who are currently on the list of defaulting insured persons, the postponement of benefits will be suspended from now until the extraordinary situation has ended.

The use of the mobile PalliativeSidelx enables COVID-19 patients in retirement homes without specialization for extreme palliative situations to be accompanied, fearless and dignified in the familiar environment.
type_sub_cat: Health Insurance
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: In Switzerland, the canton Aargau launches from the 20th of April as a preventive measure a cooperation with the swiss red cross an intensive course of studies for nursing assistants that is based on three weeks (120h) intensive courses. After finishing the course there will be a practical use of minimum 8 weeks (320h) in a retirement home, home care or in an acute-care hospital.

description:
In Switzerland, the canton Aargau gifted from the 24th to the 27th of April in total 280000 masks to around 19000 reopened businesses. Masks were handed out in the cities Baden, Frick, Klliken und Wohlen
The cantonal police of Aargau, the with the industrial and trade supervision of the office for economy and labor as well as the office for consumer protection started first checks of businesses. These checks showed that businesses own a safety concept and that they are ready to implement the guidelines by the federal office of public health.

If the controlling bodies find slight deficits they will take care of them on site. They inform and sensitize the employees and the business about the protective measures and guidelines.
type_sub_cat: Masks

description: The cantonal Government of Basel Landschaft (Switzerland) provides 200.000 masks for businesses to make it easier for them to reopen and enhance health of workers and customers. It was announced on April 24th.
type_sub_cat: Masks
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On 22nd March 2020, the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel announced that the military would provide assistance in the 2 Neuchtel hospitals from 23rd March on by making 90 soldiers and 4 ventilators available to the canton. The soldiers will take charge of basic care to allow civil medical professionals to focus on more important treatments and Covid-19 cases. On 24th April 2020, the canton announced that the military would withdraw in the evening from the cantonal hospitals, now that the peak period of the epidemic was over. The canton specified that the soldiers could be called back within 24 hours and deployed within 72 hours if the situation worsened again.
type_sub_cat: Ventilators

description: On 12th March 2020, the RHNe (hospital network) in the Swiss canton of Neuchtel decided to cancel all non-essential elective surgeries from 13th March 2020 on. The measure will be effective until further notice and during the whole peak period of the epidemic. The policy overall aims at making more resources available (hospital staff, hospital beds) to welcome Covid-19 patients. On 23rd April 2020, the RHNe announced that it would resume non-essential elective surgeries on 27th April 2020, thus ending the original policy.
type_sub_cat: Hospitals
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)
