description:
On January 25th, 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Public Health informed on its webside about a new Coronavirus outbreak in Chine.
The National Reference Center for Emerging Viral Diseases (NAVI) in Geneva is able to detect the new coronavirus by laboratory diagnostics. Suspected cases would be clarified according to the existing guidelines for MERS and, if necessary, treated.
The Head of the Division of Infectious Diseases of the university hospital of Geneva told Swiss public television on January 24: that the test is very simple: a swab is taken from the back of the throat or from the nose with a cotton bud. It would be applied to people coming back from China who present cold-like symptoms that include coughing, fever, muscular pain and breathing difficulties.
On February 27, the Swiss Canton Ticino announces that starting the next day laboratory tests on possible infections are directly carried out in Ticino.

The Canton Schaffhausen in Switzerland announced that it's hospital prepare a pre-triage to seperate persons with the Coronavirus from persons without the Virus. If the persons are tested positive they are put in Isolationfacilities inside the hospitals. The Canton Schaffhausen implemented this strategy due to the increasing number of positive tested persons in the Canton. This policy starts at March 9th 2020.
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
On March 10th, the Jura canton in Switzerland announced the conditions for testing eligibility in the province. 

In order to be eligible for testing, one must display respiratory symptoms (cough) as well as a fever and at least one of the following three criteria: presenting severe symptoms requiring hospitalization, being a "vulnerable" population segment or being a healthcare professional working in a healthcare facility.

Individuals who present symptoms but are not vulnerable won't be tested for COVID-19.

According to the announcement of March 12 and in accordance with the BAG recommendations, not all suspected COVID cases are being tested in the Canton of Zug. Tests are only necessary for people who show severe symptoms or have an increased risk of complications. In addition, tests will continue to be carried out on healthcare professionals and staff of nursing homes with mild respiratory diseases. Since March 9, the tests can be carried out in doctors' surgeries in the canton, although advance notification by telephone is mandatory. All other persons who experience symptoms of a possible respiratory disease (cough/respiratory complaints and fever) should stay at home for up to 24 hours after the symptoms have subsided and should only contact their family doctor by telephone or, if he or she cannot be reached, the emergency medical service if their state of health deteriorates.

On March 13, the Swiss Canton Grisons announces that the Federal Office of Public Health does no longer carry out comprehensive tests. Only people with symptoms from risk groups and patients with particularly severe symptoms are tested. This policy is announced together with the declaration of the "extraordinary status" in the Canton.
The Canton Basel Landschaft (Switzerland) opens two test centers on March 18 where people over 16 years with symptoms can be tested.

The Canton Schaffhausen in Switzerland opens on March 25, 2020 a center for medical testing of individuals with typical COVID-19 symptoms. This policy is implemented by the public health department of the Canton Schaffhausen. This Center is runned by Schaffhausen' physicians and is supported by the Swiss civil defence and volunteers from the health sector.
enforcer: Municipal Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
on March 26, 2020 the Swiss Canton Ticino announced the opening of 4 outpatient consultation centers dedicated only to patients potentially affected by covid-19 in Mendrisio, Lugano, Agno, Giubiasco on March 25.
Patients have to be announced and test will only be provided according to the recommendations of the Federal Office of Public Health.
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description: On March 27 the Government of Thurgau Canton has announced, that mobile Covid-19 are available for citizens. Patients who are suspected of having Covid-19 infection can be tested at home.
On April 2nd, the Canton of Bern, Switzerland opens a Drive-In-test center
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description: Swiss canton Zurich recommends all hospitals to test arriving people for SARS-CoV-2, even if they do not show any symptoms on April 2.

On April 2, the canton of Bern, Switzerland, opens a drive-through test center with online registration. Persons outside vulnerable groups are able to get tested, as well. Test capacity is increasing to 500 tests a day.

From April 14, the Swiss Canton of Fribourg published an online COVID-19 testing form to assess one's individual risk of having contracted the coronavirus for patients who do not have severe symptoms. The check then puts those individuals in contact with a testing centre, and gives further information on isolation and self-quarantine.
On 27th April 2020, the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel decided to start testing every suspect patient presenting with Covid-19 symptoms. This testing policy will be implemented from 29th April 2020 on.
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On April 30, the Swiss Canton Ticino launches a cantonal-wide serological test series with 1.500 people, which received an invitation letter. The data collected will allow to estimate the spread of the new Coronavirus in Ticino and to follow its evolution in the coming months, and will therefore be able to contribute to the development and implementation of targeted measures to prevent and control the epidemic in the medium term.

On May 7, the Swiss Canton of Fribourg published guidelines of a new testing strategy in order to be able to test more people. The strategy includes the online 'Coronacheck' test for people with mild symptoms as well as testing centres for people experiencing symptoms.

On May 8th, the Canton government announced the relaxation of previous health policies such as restrictions on doctor's visits, nursing home visits and other related medical practices. However, in addition screening will heavily increase along with an informational campaign.
In the swiss canton Valais all people with symptoms can and should be tested for the virus from May 14. Before this was valid only for severe cases or risk groups.

Switzerland, Geneva: The Council of the State announced May 28, that tests prescribed by cantonal doctors as well as tests carried out by screening centers on low-symptom individuals will be reimbursed by the canton at 76 francs.

The Canton of Zurich, Switzerland, has announced that starting on June 8th, 2020, a series of representative random tests will begin during which around 3000 people will be tested on antibodies against coronavirus.
On April 2nd, the Canton of Bern, Switzerland opens a Drive-In-test center. On 23 June, the canton of Bern, Switzerland, announces that the Drive-In test centre will be closed on 26 June.
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description: From 3 July on the Canton Zug expands the testing capacity. 1) At the Zug Cantonal Hospital, all persons can have a smear test performed in the "Walk-In" test center, without appointment. 2) In Hirslanden Andreas Clinic in Cham is a second test center. 3) As before, people with symptoms can also have themselves tested in a doctor's practice. However, advance notification by telephone is always necessary.
On July 6, the Swiss Canton Ticino publishes the first result of the serological test and announces to conduct further testing in August, November 2020 and May 2021.
Basel Landschaft (Switzerland) opens a new test center where people can be tested from 12 years age from August 1.

On February 24, the Swiss Canton Ticino reaffirms the federal list of recommendations of hygienic measures to prevent the spread of the Coronavirus:
-frequent hand washing
- limit touching one's face
- keep distance to sick people
- cough into tissues 
- wear masks only if one is sick
- stay at home in case of flue-symptoms
- avoid health facilities with influenza-like symptoms 
- not take antibiotics, if not prescribed 
- in case of doubt, one should not go to the hospital, but contact the family doctor or call the cantonal or federal hotline
link: Coronavirus, nessuna misura restrittiva in Ticino

description:
Switzerland, Geneva -- Preventive recommendations for general hygiene published on February 26, 2020. Recommendations include: 
- Wash your hands regularly with soap and water, or with a hydro-alcoholic solution.
- Cough and sneeze into a tissue. After use, throw the tissues in a trash can and wash your hands thoroughly with soap and water , or with a hydro-alcoholic solution .
- Cough and sneeze into the crook of the elbow in the absence of a tissue.

In addition to federal regulations, as of March 3, 2020, the Swiss canton of Nidwalden imposed the following requirements on organizers of events with less than 200 participants:
A list of all participants and their contact information must be kept and submitted to the health authorities, sufficient facilities for hand washing must be provided, and an information sheet by the federal health authority must be publicly displayed during the event.
type_sub_cat: Other Areas Hygiene Measures Applied
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On March 11, the Swiss Canton Ticino introduces sanitary measures in prisons, i.e. social distancing, the provision of disinfectant and 15 cells are reserved for prisoners who would have to quarantine in case they had contact with an infected person.
type_sub_cat: Other Areas Hygiene Measures Applied

description: On 12 March the Canton of Zug reminds of the BAG recommendation. In addition to regular hand washing, it is particularly important that sick people consistently stay at home. In addition, a distance of preferably two metres from other people should always be maintained if possible, for example when standing in line or in meetings.
On March 13, the Swiss Canton Grisons recommends that the population should strictly adhere to the rules of hygiene and social distancing in interpersonal relationships.
type_sub_cat: Other Areas Hygiene Measures Applied

description: On March 26, 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Health issued guidelines for burials of those who died on Covid 19.

The guidelines outline hygiene measures to be taken to allow visits of the relatives of the affected person.

description: As the protection concepts of some industry associations are not entirely clear, the Canton of Zug, Switzerland, government council has therefore decreed that masks must be worn for all services involving physical contact or where the minimum distance cannot be maintained. This concerns, among others, hairdressing salons, tattoo studios, cosmetic studios or massage parlors. The obligation to wear masks applies to all those present, i.e. both customers and employees. Not covered by these rules are stores or restaurants, as there is no physical contact and the minimum distance can be maintained.
type_sub_cat: Hygiene measures for commercial areas

description: On 28 February, the cantonal management body decides that all cantonal employees should work from home if possible.

On 4th March 2020, the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel encouraged the EMS ("tablissement mdico-sociaux"; nursing homes) in the canton to ban, or at least limit visits to residents in order to protect them from coronavirus. It recommends as well that families of residents refrain from visiting their close ones in EMS if they have symptoms or come back from a high-risk region.
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
On March 6, 2020 in Switzerland Canton Basel-City the Departement of Health has made recommendations for care homes on how to deal with visitors.
Residents of nursing homes cannot be expected not to receive a visit from their relatives and friends during the expected duration of the spread of the coronavirus. The health department therefore recommends that nursing homes limit visiting times and go through a well-developed health checklist with every visitor. If one question is answered with "yes", the person should be advised to postpone the visit.
On March 4, 2020 in Switzerland the Federal Departement of Defence and Civil Protection announced the cancellation of vacation, including weekend vaction, for key army formations starting March 7.

On 6th March 2020, the hospital network (RHNe) of the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel decided to limit visits to patients to close family and partners only. Upon discussion with the doctors in charge, exceptions will be made for patients reaching the end of their life and for children in the pediatrics department.
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: On march 6, 2020 Swiss canton Ticino is limiting visits to patients of hospitals and other healthcare and daycare facilities by time and number of visitors and banning children from visiting.

description: On 6th March 2020, the hospital network (RHNe) of the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel decided to limit visits to patients to close family and partners only. description:
On 4th March 2020, the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel encouraged the EMS ("tablissement mdico-sociaux"; nursing homes) in the canton to ban, or at least limit visits to residents in order to protect them from coronavirus. It recommends as well that families of residents refrain from visiting their close ones in EMS if they have symptoms or come back from a high-risk region. On 17th March 2020, the cantonal doctor issued a directive banning all visits in EMS, except in cases of emergency (to be assessed by the EMS supervisors). On 23rd April 2020, the cantonal doctor issued a directive reaffirming the ban on visits in EMS, but adding exceptions to this measure. Visits are only allowed in cases of emergency, especially when residents are reaching the end of their life, or when the visit happens in a specific visiting room validated by the cantonal public health office (SCSP). description:
On 28th of May the Kanton special staff ("Sonderstab") ended the general lockdown of hospitals, elderly homes and homes for the handicappped. But only homes and institutions which require the following conditions are now allowed to reopen:
-they must have a safety concept
-no people who had contact to COVID-19 infected people are allowed in
-only patients who are able to abeit to hygiene and social distancing laws are allowed to leave the instituin or home alone.
If those conditions are not met they are not allowed to reopen. If neccessary, the managements of homes and institutions are allowed to close down again.

On 13th of March 2020 the Uri special staff ("Sonderstab") decreed a visiting ban for the Kanton hospital, all nursing homes, all retirement homes, all homes for the handicapped until 30th of April. Exemptions can be made by the Kanton hospital for partners of parturients, parents, affiliated people of a dying person. The policy was prolonged to 31st of May but ended earlier on 28th of May.

On June 5th, the government of the Swiss Canton of Solothurn announced that hospitals would have to develop a hygiene concept to allow visitors. Minimum requirements include visitor identification and recording, not more than two visitors at shared rooms at a time and visitors following the same hygienic measures as healthcare staff (e.g. wearing masks). The policy was scheduled to start on June 6th.

On June 6th, 2020, the Swiss canton of Appenzell Innerrhoden has further lifted the original restriction on visits to hospitals, elderly homes, and facilities for people with disabilities. Visits do not longer need to be pre-registered, however, all visitors need to register at the entrance, record their personal information, and verify that they do not show any Covid-19 symptoms. Public cafeterias and restaurants within the facilities are allowed to reopen under the condition that they meet the general health advice and guarantee for social distance.

Since May 11, 2020, visits to hospitals, elderly homes, and facilities for people with disabilities in Appenzell Innerrhoden, Switzerland, are allowed under certain conditions, including mandatory registration before the visit, and limited visiting time, while also being limited to specially created visiting zones within the facility. These zones are to be disinfected after each visit. This order is set to at least remain until June 30, 2020.

description: On 8th June 2020, the RHNe announced visits could resume under conditions in its centers of Pourtals and la Chaux-de-Fonds (more generally in all of its centers - see records 2360005 and 8718977 for the other centers)  from 9th June 2020 on. According to the new visiting regime, visits are limited to one visitor per day per patient, for one hour between 3pm and 5pm. The RHNe also added exceptions to this new visiting system: 1) the two parents can visit their children in the pediatrics department 2) the father and the siblings of a newborn can visit the mother and the baby at the maternity ward 3) more visits can be allowed for dying people or patients in intensive care.
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On 20th May 2020, the RHNe (hospital network) of the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel announced that on their center of la Chrysalide, visits will only be allowed upon decision from the medical team. This decision will be made on a case-by-case basis, depending on the patient's medical state. The medical team will also decide under which conditions visits are allowed for a patient. Only first-degree relatives will be allowed to visit patients. On 8th June 2020, the RHNe announced a new visiting regime for all of their centers (including la Chrysalide) from 9th June 2020 on: visits are limited to one visitor per day per patient, for one hour between 3pm and 5pm. It also added exceptions to this new visiting system: 1) the two parents can visit their children in the pediatrics department 2) the father and the siblings of a newborn can visit the mother and the baby at the maternity ward 3) more visits can be allowed for dying people or patients in intensive care.
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On 20th May 2020, the RHNe (hospital network) of the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel announced that visits could resume under conditions in the rehabilitation centers of Locle and Val-de-Ruz. Conditions are the following: patients are only allowed to receive one visitor per day for one hour between 4pm and 6pm. Each visitor will have to wear a mask and to disinfect his/her hands. Only first-degree relatives will be allowed to visit patients. On 8th June 2020, the RHNe announced a new visiting regime for all of their centers (including Locle and Val-de-Ruz) from 9th June 2020 on. In the case of Locle and Val-de-Ruz, visits are still limited to one visitor per day per patient, still for one hour but now between 3pm and 5pm. The RHNe also added exceptions to this new visiting system: 1) the two parents can visit their children in the pediatrics department 2) the father and the siblings of a newborn can visit the mother and the baby at the maternity ward 3) more visits can be allowed for dying people or patients in intensive care.
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On 20th May 2020, the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel confirmed that visits in the RHNe (Neuchtel hospital network) were still banned in their centers of la Chaux-de-Fonds and Pourtals (i.e. their classic, intensive-care centers) up until at least 8th June 2020. Exceptions to this policy are: 1) patients coming for an appointment in the oncology, obstetrics and neurology departments 2) patients who have to be accompanied for health reasons 3) if the medical team determines that visits for a patient are necessary. On 8th June 2020, the RHNe announced that from 9th June 2020 on, visits could resume under conditions in the centers of la Chaux-de-Fonds and Pourtals, thus ending the original policy.
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: From June 10, the Swiss Canton of Fribourg re-allowed visits to the Fribourg Network for Mental Health (FPNG), as well as the running of group therapies with social distancing measures.

From June 24, the Swiss Canton of Fribourg announced that visits of siblings to birth centres will be allowed again. Their number is restricted to 1 sibling at a time which needs to be accompanied and supervised by the other parent.

From June 29, the health task force of the Swiss Canton of Fribourg requires all care institutions to maintain hygiene and distancing measures, while the systematic control of all entries into the institutions is not required anymore. However, a physical barrier needs to be maintained at the entry and visitors will be traced. Residents are allowed to leave the facilities again as long as they or their relatives are able to abide by the hygiene and behavioural measures, and to identify contacts. Exceptional situations, such as the end of life, immune weakness, minors, etc., will be decided upon individually. The implementation of these measures will be supported by a mobile COVID-Team of care workers, representatives of the care institutions, of the municipalities, and of a doctor who will be in charge.
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: From May 9, the Swiss Canton of Fribourg eased the lockdown restrictions imposed upon care homes in the canton, allowing relatives of resident to visit again. Visits will only be allowed to residents without confirmed COVID-19 infection and without suspicion of having contracted the virus. In addition care homes will need to have a safety plan complying with health restrictions to limit infections, including clear restrictions on registration, reception, hours and duration of visits, allowed set of individuals for visits, follow up, and hygiene measures. The measures were further eased from June 29.
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: From July 1, the Swiss Canton of Fribourg announced eased lockdown restrictions for its hospitals, clinics, and birth centres. Under the new restrictions, the number of visitors is limited to 1 per day, visitors will need to be free of symptoms, they need to abide by the federal hygiene and distancing measures, they need to abide by the specific guidelines of the responsible institution/department, and visitors need to register while institutions need to keep a visitor list in order to allow tracing in the case of an infection.

On 3rd July 2020, the Swiss canton of Neuchtel recommended EMS ("tablissements mdico-sociaux", nursing homes) to restrict visits to residents in terms of number of visitors within the same timeframe and in terms of duration of visits, so as to protect residents from Covid-19.
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

From October 22, Valais (Switzerland) prohibits visits in hospitals and care facilities.

description: The Canton of Zug formed 1) a tripartite delegation of the Government Council for strategic management and crisis management, consisting of Landammann Stephan Schleiss, Health Director Martin Pfister and Security Director Beat Villiger. 2) A "Corona-Stab" task force was formed. The Corona-Stab supported this delegation in its operational tasks from 13 March onwards. The core staff of the cantonal executive staff, which supported the cantonal government during the Corona crisis and coordinated the measures, will end its service on 10 June 2020. At the same time, the hotline of the Canton of Zug, which had been available to the population for more than three months to answer questions about the Corona crisis, will be discontinued.

description: In response to measures on march 20 2020, the Cantonal Sport Aid Fund, the Canton of Geneva and the City of Geneva have joined forces to provide an emergency service (Cantonal Sport Aid Fund) in the form of a single online portal specific to the sports sector while also organizing two meetings in the form of online conferences in order to comply with the different semi-confinement measures taken by the Federal Council. Through this platform, the public authorities want to understand the economic consequences linked to covid-19 with regard to the management of associations and/or the organisation of sporting events. The associations concerned will soon have the opportunity to submit an online request for exceptional assistance in order to offset any losses suffered.

description: On March 22, 2020 in Switzerland the three cantons of Basel-City, Basel-Landschaft and Jura announced that the French Departement Haut-Rhin sent an urgent request for support to the three cantons on March 20. In consultation with the federal authorities, the three governments have agreed that ICU patients from France can be transferred to the cantonal hospitals. Further Swiss cantons ( Aargau, Bern, Fribourg, Geneva, Lucerne, Neuchtel, Saint Gallen, Schaffhausen, Thurgau, Vaud, Valais, Zurich ) offered help and took ICU patients from French regions Grand-Est and Franche-Comt.

The people affected are informed in the plane, in the coach and at the border crossings and must report to the cantonal registration office immediately after entering the Canton. Those who evade quarantine can be fined up to 10,000 francs.

description: On July 7, the Swiss Canton Grisons announces the set up of a cantonal central registration point for incoming people that are subject to mandatory quarantine imposed by the federal policy of July 6 for people entering the country form a state or area with a high risk of infection. The people affected are specifically informed in the plane, in the coach and at the border crossings and must report to the cantonal registration office immediately after entering the country. description: From October 1, 2020, events with more than 1000 participants can take place again, if the canton approves them. This was decided by the Federal Council. The Zug police is already responsible for events with event risks and therefore has experience with the corresponding permits. For this reason, the Government Council also uses them as a licensing authority for major events in the sense of the Covid 19 ordinance, but the Government Council remains responsible for revoking them. Depending on the situation, the Zug police may impose conditions additional to the hygiene protection concept submitted by the organizers.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration

description: On March 19, 2020 in Switzerland Canton Geneva the Public Prosecutor's Office has informed that the criteria to arrest people were reviewed by the Attorney General to reduce the number of people expected to be detained by waiving the detention of persons affected by the conversion of fines or pecuniary penalties, as well of those who have to serve a sentence who are not detained and by ordering the police to focus their efforts on those offenders who put society at risk, according to RTS (RadioTV Suisse).

description: The Swiss civil defense service is going to support the canton Glarus. Members of the civil defense service are going to support health care facilities and members of the health care service and hospital with logistical support. This policy was announced on March 20, 2020.

description: The Swiss Canton Ticino makes use of the exceptional extension of restriction under certain conditions, allowed by a federal law that will come into force retroactively on March 21, when Ticino introduced the closure regime, this means that Ticino will no longer be illegally implementing restrictions not allowed under federal laws.
type_text: The federal law of March 13 announced that construction sites and business remain open with security measures. However, due to the worsening situation in the Canton Swiss, the Cantonal government decided to not follow and closed all construction sites and businesses. On March 27, the Federal Government then decided that Cantons, under certain circumstances, could go further and take stricter restrictive measures if they applied for it. Ticino implemented the exception clause immediately.

description: On the 21st March 2020, The Swiss Federal Department of Foreign Affairs (FDFA) releases the plan to return 630 Swiss tourists from Latin America (Peru & Colombia) in cooperation with the airline Edelweiss, with Two charter flights planned for 24-25 March 2020.

description: On 24th March 2020, the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel announced that its Department of consumption and veterinarian affairs could now take care of pets whose owners either had to go to the hospital due to Covid-19, or were sick and alone at home. Upon request by phone or email, the department will come and pick up the pet, and will charge the owner accordingly.

type_text: A platform was set up to gather resources for better physical and mental health during the COVID-19 pandemic.

description: On March 27, the Swiss Federal Government allowed Cantons under certain circumstances (insufficient capacities, elevated number of cross-border commuters) to temporarily restrict or stop the activity of entire economic sectors as opposed to the federal law. This policy was politicised as "Lex Ticino" as it was tailormade for its case.
type_text: The Swiss Federal Government issued a regulation which allowed Cantons that were especially affected by the pandemic and did not have sufficient resources to close or restrict further certain economic activities, even though the federal law was not restricting them. This policy was mainly targeted at the Swiss Canton Ticino, which decided to keep construction sites closed even though the Federal Government announced to keep them open. The policy thus allows Ticino to go implement stricter measures than the Federal Government.

description: From March 30, the Swiss Canton of Fribourg is providing its schools and teaching staff with Office 365 software in order to facilitate online learning.
type_text: A regulation for schools which does not fit into the categories provided unter 'Closure and regulation of schools'.

description: On March 19, the Swiss canton of Solothurn announced that the deadline for filing tax declarations for the fiscal year 2019 would be extended from March 31 to July 31 due to the pandemic. Furthermore, lost revenues due to COVID-19-related restrictions would be considered as hardships, possibly allowing for relaxations of payment requirements upon request.

description: On 2nd April 2020, the Swiss canton of Neuchtel decided to temporarily reopen the welcome center for asylum seekers in Couvet (in addition to the permanent center in Tte-de-Ran). This policy aims at better complying with the Covid-related health recommendations (social distancing, quarantine if a resident is sick and has to isolate...). Several asylum seekers currently in the permanent center are to be transferred to Couvet in order to make the most of the available space of both centers.
type_text: The canton of Neuchtel temporarily reopened a welcome center for asylum seekers in Couvet so as to better comply with Covid-related health recommendations. Some residents are to be transferred from the permanent center to Couvet.

The service is aimed in particular at specialized baccalaureate courses, complementary modules, social worker operators (OSA) and socio-health operators (OSS). The aim is to provide enhanced listening and accompaniment to the students who are experiencing the professional experience at the forefront of this particular pandemic moment.

description:
On 15th April 2020, the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel created a new organizational system for doctors' offices in order to separate Covid-19 suspect patients from other patients in need of regular medical monitoring. From 20th April 2020 on, 3 networks of doctors' offices are to be distinguished:

1) NETWORK A: only patients without Covid-19 who suffer from a chronic illness or another serious health problem requiring regular medical monitoring

2) NETWORK B (separated in 2 distinct channels): 
a. in the first channel, patients without Covid-19 who suffer from a chronic illness or another serious health problem requiring regular medical monitoring
b. in the second channel, patients suspect or diagnosed with Covid-19

3) NETWORK C: only patients suspect or diagnosed with Covid-19 who are presenting with aggravated symptoms
type_text: On 15th April 2020, the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel created a new organizational system for doctors' offices in order to separate Covid-19 suspect patients from other patients in need of regular medical monitoring. 3 networks of doctors' offices are then to be distinguished ; patients shall be directed to one or the other network depending on his Covid-19 symptoms (or absence of Covid-19 symptoms).
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
On 15th April 2020, the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel created a new organizational system for doctors' offices in order to separate Covid-19 suspect patients from other patients in need of regular medical monitoring. From 20th April 2020 on, 3 networks of doctors' offices are to be distinguished:

1) NETWORK A: only patients without Covid-19 who suffer from a chronic illness or another serious health problem requiring regular medical monitoring

2) NETWORK B (separated in 2 distinct channels): 
a. in the first channel, patients without Covid-19 who suffer from a chronic illness or another serious health problem requiring regular medical monitoring
b. in the second channel, patients suspect or diagnosed with Covid-19

3) NETWORK C: only patients suspect or diagnosed with Covid-19 who are presenting with aggravated symptoms

Patients are to be directed in one or the other network depending on their needs (treatment for chronic illness or Covid-19).
type_text: On 15th April 2020, the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel created a new organizational system for doctors' offices in order to separate Covid-19 suspect patients from other patients in need of regular medical monitoring. From 20th April 2020 on, 3 networks of doctors' offices are to be distinguished and patients are to be directed in one or the other network depending on their needs (treatment for chronic illness or Covid-19).

description:
On July 2nd, 2020 the government council of Swiss Canton Basel-City decided to hold the operators and organizers of facilities and events more accountable. They must now ensure the correctness of the collected visitor data by checking the identity card or in another way. A corresponding ordinance on additional measures will come into force on Monday, July 6, 2020 and will apply until December 31, 2020.
This does not apply to visitors of restaurants.

note: According to the federal regulation, organizers must collect visitor data if social distancing or the wearing of masks is not guaranteed.
type_text: ensuring the correctness of visitors data collected by organizers of events to ease contact tracing

description:
The Canton Schaffhausen introduced a mandatory mask wearing for secondary schools (Kantonsschule, Berufsfachschulen, HKV). From August 10 onwards, students, teachers and other personnel have to wear masks inside schools. Exceptions are:
- when there is a minimum distance between people, 
- when there are seperating walls between people,
- teachers don't have to wear masks in frontal teaching classes,
- no mask wearing in sports classes,
- people don't have to wear masks when they are eating in the cantines,
- when people have a medical issue which allows them not to wear masks.

Students, teachers and other personnel have to bring their own masks, but in case the schools have to provide free masks for everyone. 
Furthermore when someone is coming back from a Covid-19 country of risk, this person is obliged to go into quarantine. 
Finally teachers, students and other school personnel have to self-declare that they are informed about the quarantine and mask rules in schools.
type_text: The obligation to wear masks in secondary schools

description: On February 24, 2020 in Switzerland the government of Canton Valais launched an information page on the website of the Health Service at https://www.vs.ch/covid-19 . This summarizes all relevant information for health professionals and the public and is updated as required.

Switzerland, February 27th, The Canton Ticino set up a special hotline for general and sanitary information, as well as for psychological in the context of Covid-19. The number can be reached every day from 7 am to 10 pm free of cost. The questions will be answered by specially trained Civil Protection personnel and supported by professional operators from the Ticino Rescue unit. It is set to avoid overloading the Cantonal Doctor's Office, 144 (medical emergencies) and 117 (police emergencies).

description:

Therefore an information campaign for travelers and commuters at the borders and airports was started. A second information campaign on personal protection measures "So schtzen wir uns" (Protect yourself and others) is aimed at the general public. In a first step, the FOPH would like to make three important hygiene and behavior rules known: Wash your hands thoroughly, cough and sneeze into a tissue or the crook of your arm, stay at home if you have fever or a cough.

description:
On March 5, 2020 the Swiss FOPH added a seventh hygiene rule to the campaign Protect yourself and others : Keep your distance e.g. Protect the elderly by keeping a save distance. Keep your distance from others in a queue.  Keep your distance at meetings.The new poster and flyer can be downloaded from the FOPHs webside.	
The rule: "Dispose of used paper tissues in a sealed waste bin	" has been erased from the posters.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government
link: NA ; https://web.archive.org/web/20200309120051/https://foph-coronavirus.ch/downloads/ ; FOPH ; protect yourself and others downloads March 5

description: On March 6, the State Council's directorate for health and social affairs of the Swiss Canton of Fribourg launched a targeted communication campaign to health staff, municipalities, schools, childcare facilities, higher education institutions, care homes, and institutions for persons with disabilities, as well as to different state departments and the companies responsible for public transport.

description: The canton Glarus follows the new strategy of the Swiss federal goverment, to use the health resources in an optimal way. That means that persons with Covid-19 symptoms should stay at home, until the symptoms haven't emerged at least for a day. The cantonal authorities announced that policy on March 7th 2020.

description: On February 28th, the government of the Swiss Canton Solothurn announced that organizers of events with 100 to 999 participants would have to conduct a risk assessment with the Canton government via a hotline. This was scheduled to begin on February 29th. On March 4th, the Canton government announced that from that day on, the lower participant bound would be changed from 100 to 150. As part of the national government's ban on events for more than 100 participants, the Canton government announced on March 13th, that the requirement of such risk assessment would end on the same day.
type_sub_cat: Both Disseminating and Gathering information related to COVID-19

description: On March 20, Ticino sets up a complementary communication and information channel on Instagram, administrated and implemented by the Health prevention and promotion service of the Cantonal Doctor's Office. The profile name is "promozione_salute" and is directed to reach also the younger audience. The profile will promote the prevention campaign "Distant but close - Let's protect ourselves.Now".

description: On March 20, 2020, the Swiss canton of Solothurn began the distribution of 10,000 flyers to its senior citizens, urging them to stay home at all times, except for urgent reasons. Furthermore, an information hotline would be available as part of the campaign.

description: On March 27, the State Council of the Swiss Canton of Fribourg started disseminating information on COVID-19 in 12 different languages (French, German, English, Portuguese, Spanish, Arabic, Farsi, Kurdish, Somali, Tamil, Tigrinya, and Turkish) to the public in the form of flyers, audio material and videos, in order to reach a wide public, including migrant communities.

description: On 27th March 2020, the Swiss Canton of Neuchtel opened a website called "Gardons le Cap" in collaboration with the Canton of Jura. This website aims at indexing all resources available to the population so as to cope with isolation and take care of one's health - both physical and mental. It also includes a list of Covid-related volunteering opportunities in Neuchtel and Jura for those who either seek help or want to help.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: From March 27, the Swiss Canton of Fribourg started to streaming press and media conferences live in an accessible way to the public and media representatives.

description: On March 27th, the Jura canton announced that an information hotline was being set up to answer all concerns related to COVID-19 from health to economic measures. That hotline replaces the previous different ones that were set up through the previous month.

description: On March 27, the State Council of the Swiss Canton of Fribourg announced the targeted dissemination of information in form of audio and videos on the prevention of COVID-19 in eight languages (Arabic, Farsi, Kurmandschi, Somali, Tamil, Tibetan, Tigrinya, and Turkish) to asylum seekers and migrant communities.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On March 30, the Swiss Canton of Fribourg launched a new hotline (telephone line) responsible for questions of the public related to daily life and COVID-19. The hotline offers daily-life (Monday-Friday) and psychosocial support (Monday-Sunday) to the public.

description: On March 30, the Swiss Canton of Fribourg launched a new hotline (telephone line) responsible for questions of the public related to daily life and COVID-19. description: The Canton of Lucerne, Switzerland, has, on the 31st of March, initiated a telephone hotline on Covid-19 which gave citizens information on the cantonal policies and guidelines during the severe phase of the pandemic. The hotline was shut down on the 22nd of June, 2020.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On April 1, the Cantonal government and the General Staff of conduct launch a new message to draw attention to the importance of individual responsibility in the health emergency.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On April 1, the Cantonal government of Ticino recalls the network against domestic violence and ensures the protection and support of the Canton, provided in any case. The network against domestic violence has also intensified awareness raising for families through the activation of information messages on popular sites and through newsletters and social media.
type_sub_cat: Both Disseminating and Gathering information related to COVID-19

description: On April 2, the Swiss Canton of Fribourg released information about support services domestically abused and domestic abusers. The message also encouraged contacting the police including the clear statement that, despite the lockdown, fleeing an abusive situation is not prohibited. As well as to affected persons, the awareness measure is also directed at neighbours to take action.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On April 2, the Swiss Canton Grisons encourages that victims of domestic violence, that might arise from the measures against the spread of the coronavirus, to refer to cantonal services that provide help, protection and advice. These advice and support services are still there for those affected. With the slogan "DARE YOU!" those affected should be encouraged to seek help and support.
type_sub_cat: Both Disseminating and Gathering information related to COVID-19

description: On April 2, the government of Schwyz provided their districts and municipalities with posters with information pertaining to mass gatherings and observing the hygiene and distance regulation.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description:
On April 2, 2020 in Switzerland the government of Canton Jura informed the population on the importance of the protective measures against COVID 19, stay at home whenever possible, keep distance and avoid gathering.The cantonal police implements means to ensure compliance in all places, in particular by an equestrian brigade to easily access tourist sites where a high concentration of people can be expected. 
In addition, the Jura cantonal police ask bikers not to take the road during this extraordinary period. A simple fall could lead to the occupation of a hospital bed for several days and overload the health network.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On April 4, the Swiss Canton of Fribourg issued a message asking the public to respect the regular rules of protecting natural habitats and vegetation, in order to protect nature and prevent dangers, while going on hikes during the COVID-19 pandemic.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On April 6, the Swiss Canton of Fribourg launched the Instagram account "fr_together" that informs together with stakeholders about life and work during the fight against the COVID-19 epidemic.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate
enforcer: New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On April 6, the Swiss Canton Grisons announces the launch of a telephone service for psychological first aid as of April 7. The helpline is a first point of contact for help in emergency situations in connection with the extraordinary situation of the pandemic Covid-19. In a supportive conversation, people seeking help are advised by specialists, made aware of offers in the canton of Graubnden and, if necessary, forwarded to the appropriate places.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On April 8, the Swiss Canton Ticino publishes a guideline and useful information regarding the use and quality of disinfectants and products suitable for the correct cleaning and disinfection of domestic environments.

description: On April 8th, the Jura canton in Switzerland launched a public awareness campaign specifically targeted at encouraging people to stay home during the Easter holiday. The slogan of the campaign read "during Eastern, I stay home".

description: On April 9, the Swiss Canton of Fribourg published a video message including three practitioners and three public personalities, asking the population to stay home over the Easter celebrations.

description: On April 9, 2020 the Swiss FOPH promoted a free online Eastern - themed game emphazising that the message, even over Easter, is to stay at home and not have friends or family round. Only then can we continue to curb the spread of the new coronavirus. Play Bunny Madness to pass the time instead! A reward is being offered for the highest score by the end of the day on April 13.

description: In Switzerland Canton Aargau the government council emphazised the requirement to stay home and avoid family gatherings over easter by video message on April 9th 2020.

description: On April 14, the Swiss Canton Ticino reminds that the Covid-19 hotline can also be consulted for issues or information regarding domestic violence.

description: On April 15, the Swiss Canton of Fribourg published a message encouraging people experiencing a health issue (in relation to Covid-19 or not) to go to a health facility, and not to wait until the pandemic is over. description: On April 22, the Swiss Canton of Fribourg published a message reminding the public that the annual tradition of singing on the 1st of May does not conform with the restriction of mass gatherings imposed by the federal government. Therefore, they recommend to children's and youth groups not to engage in the tradition, and the message announces suggested alternatives that will be posted.

description: On the 29 th of April 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Public Health made available a poster called " The ten steps for mental Health". The goal of this  public awareness poster was to share ways to stay mentally healthy during an extraordinary situation ( Covid-19 pandemic).

description: The Swiss Federal Council releases public awareness campaign to promote Keeping your distance, washing your hands thoroughly and sneezing into the crook of your arm despite other covid-19 related restrictions easing.

description: On May 5, the Swiss Canton of Fribourg's cantonal leadership body (KFO), in cooperation with the cantonal radio station, hosted 2 public awareness radio shows replying to the questions of children and teenagers about the coronavirus.

description: The canton of Zurich, Switzerland, announced on May 6th, 2020, that it is offering online information on the virus, including topic bulletins in 12 languages, to especially help migrants and refugees handle the current guidelines and hygiene measures.

description: Basel Landschaft (Switzerland) offers a psychiatric hotline for people worrying about Covid-19 on March 26. The hotline will be ended on May 7 due to decreasing demand.

description: The Swiss Canton Ticino launches a new awareness campaign facing the second phase of reopening on May 11. The Campaign "Distanti ripartiamo" extends to "Mi proteggo, ti proteggo" recommends continuing to respect the rules of physical distance and increased hygiene as well as to keep one updated with the last materials provided by the Canton.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On May 8, amid the easing national lockdown from May 11, the Swiss Canton of Fribourg recommended to the public to maintain hygiene and distancing measures to prevent the spread of the virus, including to keep working from home, to walk, cycle, or to take public transport (whilst wearing a mask and maintain distancing).
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On May 8th, the Canton government announced the relaxation of previous health policies such as restrictions on doctor's visits, nursing home visits and other related medical practices. However, in addition screening will heavily increase along with an informational campaign.
type_sub_cat: Both Disseminating and Gathering information related to COVID-19

description: On May 11, the Swiss Canton Ticino issues recommendations on the use of masks. Protective masks should be used in case of prolonged contact and where physical distances cannot be guaranteed. In cases where contact is short and distances are guaranteed, the mask is of no use. When, on the other hand, the distance cannot be guaranteed during short contacts, or in the case of prolonged contacts guaranteeing the distance, the mask can be useful.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On May 20, the Swiss Canton Ticino releases and distributes a new awareness campaign especially for tourists Bentornati in Ticino! Distanti e responsabili anche in vacanza" with information and reminders of social distancing and hygiene measures that need to be followed.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On May 20th, the Canton of Vaud made a public service announcement stating they have formulated a long-term COVID-19 strategy. Furthermore they urge all those with symptoms or who have been in contact to get tested.

description: The canton Glarus established various information hotlines, so that citizens can ask their questions about the Covid-19 pandemic and the situation in the canton and country. This information hotline was established on March 22, 2020. It stops on May 29.

description: On June 5, the Swiss Canton Ticino, more precisely the Cyber Safe Group of the Canton Ticino organized a video conference event on facial recognition and control of social distance in which the public was able to participate using the Microsoft Team platform. The video was published on the canton's YouTube channel.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On June 8th, Canton of Vaud made a publishment of its research into COVID in order to disseminate information regarding the effectiveness of Vaud's policies and new information regarding COVID

description: On June 12, the State Council of the Swiss Canton of Fribourg published a report on the management and the measures taken in response to the COVID-19 pandemic.

description:
On June 22, the Swiss Canton Ticino clarifies that the use of air conditioning does not represent a risk factor for the spread of coronavirus. Furthermore advises on its use are given, such as to avoid
air recirculation function, regardless of the use of air conditioning, to regularly open the windows for a few minutes during the day to allow for air exchange, to keep the air flow of air conditioners in shared offices / spaces to a minimum, to avoid using monobloc removable air conditioners in shared offices / spaces.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On June 24, the Swiss Canton of Fribourg published a message informing about the rising cases of COVID-19 within the canton, and pointing to the compulsory distancing measures and available tracking app that will be available from June 25.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description:
On June 29th, 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Public Health announced a new Infochannel on WhatsApp providing a wide range of information about the coronavirus.
You can choose from the following topics:
    Contact Tracing
    SwissCovid app
    Masks
    Precautionary measures
    Travel
    Situation in Switzerland
    Background knowledge
Contact details are anonymised and not stored.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On July 23, the Swiss Canton Ticino reminds of the services and contacts available in order to make the population more aware of the importance of national quarantine policy. The information, channels, hotlines etc. are published on the official Cantonal website.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: The canton of Zug is launching a campaign with the name "So schtzt sich Zug" in the week of 29 July to draw attention to the most important protective measures against the coronavirus. Returning travellers from risk areas should be increasingly informed and sensitised
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On August 19, the Swiss Canton of Fribourg published a message about the positive testing of 4 people who were at a bar on August 13 and the subsequent quarantine of 500 individuals. The measure emphasises the importance of complying with quarantine and health restrictions in order to mitigate the spread of the virus.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On August 31st, the Canton of Vaud released a statement from it's council saying it strongly opposes the measures to limit open borders as it would sunder economic recovery.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: The swiss canton Valais starts a new Campaign called "Bliib gsund!" ("Stay in good health!") on September 15 to remind about the safety measures (washing hands, wearing masks...).
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On September 15th, the Canton of Vaud announced a long lieu of official measures it had taken as well as announcing it's upcoming strategies for October and November.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On September 18th, Canton Vaud released several statements detailing the necessary adoption of ad hoc plans and containment measures. Despite this, the Canton insists it is within researched parameters and is seemingly improving the situation.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: Nationwide Committee of Tajikistans Health Care and Social Protection Workers Union in cooperation with the ILO Bureau for Workers Activities (ACTRAV) in Dushanbe organised a conference Effects of COVID-19 on Tajikistans Health Care and Health Workers. Pandemic Response, Social Dialogue and Policies to Promote Occupational Safety and Health of Tajikistans Health Workers at Work.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On the 11th of November 2020, the Swiss Federal Office of Public Health made available in most of the migration languages, the main poster of the public awareness campaign "Protect yourself and others". The goal is to share the basics Covid-19 tips to everybody.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On the 12th of November 2020, The Swiss Federal Office of Public Health released a statement emphasizing on the importance of visiting the "Isolation and Quarantine" website if tested positive or in contact with a person infected by the Corona virus.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On the 19th of November 2020, the Swiss Federal Office of Health released a video of public awareness about the importance of ventilation. Schoolrooms have to be aired out regularly to reduce the risk of infection, especially now during the coronavirus epidemic. The new video shows schoolchildren how to air out properly.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On the 1st of December 2020, the Swiss FOPH released as part of the  public awareness campaign "Protect yourself and others " new printed material. The goal of this action was to state the importance of being tested for Covid-19 if any symptom occurs. The poster also focuses on the fact that tests are free of charge.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: As part of the  public awareness campaign "Protect yourself and others" the Swiss Federal Office of public health released  on the 9th of December 2020 a new poster showing tips on how to restrain contacts before the Christmas Holidays.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On the 9th of December 2020, the Swiss FOPH made available a new poster as part of the public awareness campaign "protect yourself and others".The poster is showing organizations providing help regarding mental health issues.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On December 3rd 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Public Health announced that on Thursday December 10, a nationwide day (Talk about it, find help) will draw attention to the consequences of the Covid-19 crisis on mental health.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On the 28th of October 2020, the Swiss FOPH made available a new poster as part of the public awareness campaign "protect yourself and others".The poster is showing organizations providing help regarding mental health issues.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On February 4, 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Health recommended on its webside to all persons having returned from China within the last 14 days: If you develop symptoms of a respiratory tract infection (fever, cough, shortness of breath)  stay at home, do not go out in public and contact a doctor immediately, by telephone first.
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
The Swiss Federal Office of Public Health informed on its webside for health professionals ( February 17, 2020) that suspected cases (meeting the test criteria) and persons who tested positive for the coronavirus have to be isolated. The cantonal departements of health decide if the person is to be isolated at home or its hotelroom or is transferred to a hospital isolation ward. 
According to some newspapers and cantonal websides the people who tested positive had to be isolated in isolation wards of hospitals.
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)

description:
On its press conference on February 25, 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Health informed about the first person in Switzerland confirmed as being infected with the new coronavirus 2019-nCoV. People in close contact with the individual are being notified and placed in quarantine and their condition will be monitored over the next 14 days. On its webside ( February 16) the FOPH informed:" Should there be cases, the sick people would be isolated. Close Contact persons would have to be in quarantine for two weeks."  On the webside for health professionals ( Feb 17) the term close contact is specified:
Contact from less than 2 meters and for more than 15 minutes. People who live in the same household. Care or medical examination without protective gear. Direct contact with body fluids.
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)

description:
On February 26, 2020 the Swiss Federal Offiec of Public Health informed on its website: "If you have recently spent time in an area affected by the coronavirus. For 14 days after your departure:    If you have difficulties breathing, a cough or fever, stay at home or in your hotel. Do not go out in public. Immediately contact  first by phone  a doctor or health centre. Mention that you have recently been in an area affected by the coronavirus and have symptoms." Travelers and commuters from Italy are informed at the borders what to do if they have symptoms (difficulty breathing, cough or fever).People arriving at the airports are also informed.
affected areas are currently: China, Iran, Southkorea, Singapore, and in Italy the provinces Lombardy, Piemont and Venetia.
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Foreign Affairs

target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description:
On 1 March, the Canton of Bern, Switzerland, announced that children should not attend school if:
- they have visited an area hit by Corona and were in close contact with someone who has Corona,
- if they have returned from an area hit by Corona in the last 14 days and have symptoms of coughing, breathing problems, and fever,
- if they have a fever.
type_sub_cat: Other Quarantine
type_text: Children are not to attend school under certain conditions

description: On February 28, the Swiss Canton Ticino advises all parents to keep children with flu symptoms (fever, cough, cold) at home with the reopening of schools as of March 2.
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)

description:
On March 6, 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Health releases guidelines (valid from March 9th) for symptomatic persons and their contacts:
Persons with symptoms of an acute respiratory illness (fever and cough):
 Stay at home for up to 24 hours after the symptoms have subsided (self-isolation)
 Only call a doctor if Your state of health requires this:
   - If the risk of complications is increased (particularly at risk) 
   - in case of dyspnoea
   - if respiratory symptoms worsen
Your close contact persons (people living in the same household, intimate contacts) are instructed to pay attention to their state of health so that they can go into self-isolation as soon as they develop symptoms.
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)

description:
On March 6, 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Health releases guidelines ( valid from March 9th) for persons who had close contact with someone who tested positive for the coronavirus.
Hospital doctors and doctors in private practice instruct the close contact persons (people living in the same household, intimate contacts) of the confirmed cases to stay at home for 5 days after the onset of symptoms (of the confirmed case) and to pay attention to their state of health, and to go into self-isolation if symptoms occur.
Health professionals who had unprotected contact (professional or private) with a confirmed case  continue to work, always wear a surgical mask, ensure perfect hand hygiene and monitor their health.
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)

description:
On March 6, 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Health releases guidelines for dealing with confirmed cases from March 9, 2020 and an information sheet (March 7): What to do if you are infected with the new Coronavirus.
confirmed cases are isolated:
  At home, if the general condition permits (self-isolation)
Removal of isolation: 48 hours after the symptoms have subsided, provided that at least 10 days have passed since the onset of symptoms
  In severe cases in the hospital:
 Return home as soon as the clinical condition permits, or removal of isolation in the hospital in accordance with the criteria listed above.
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

description:
On March 10th, the Jura canton in Switzerland issue new guidelines in relation to quarantine for COVID-19 cases.

If health condition allows it, positive cases have to isolate at home. Isolation ends 48 hours after symptoms disappear. 

If the case is severe, the patient will be hospitalized. The patient will return home whenever their state allows it and isolation ends 48 hours after symptoms disappear.
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)

description:
On March 10th, the Jura canton in Switzerland issued new guidelines in relation to quarantine for people who were in contact with confirmed COVID-19 cases.

The individuals must stay at home for 5 days from the onset of symptoms for the confirmed case. They must be wary of the state of their health and avoid contact with vulnerable populations.
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)

description:
On March 6, 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Health releases guidelines (valid from March 9th) for symptomatic persons and their contacts:
Persons with symptoms of an acute respiratory illness (fever and cough):
 Stay at home for up to 24 hours after the symptoms have subsided (self-isolation)
 Only call a doctor if Your state of health requires this:
   - If the risk of complications is increased (particularly at risk) 
   - in case of dyspnoea
   - if respiratory symptoms worsen
Your close contact persons (people living in the same household, intimate contacts) are instructed to pay attention to their state of health so that they can go into self-isolation as soon as they develop symptoms.
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)

description:
On March 6, 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Health releases recommendations ( valid from March 9th) for persons who had close contact with someone tested positive for the coronavirus.
Hospital doctors and doctors in private practice instruct the close contact persons (people living in the same household, intimate contacts) of the confirmed cases to stay at home for 5 days after the onset of symptoms (of the confirmed case) and to pay attention to their state of health, and to go into self-isolation if symptoms occur.
Health professionals who had unprotected contact with a confirmed case (professional or private) continue to work, always wear a surgical mask, ensure perfect hand hygiene and monitor their health.
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)

description:
On March 6, 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Health releases guidelines for dealing with confirmed cases from March 9, 2020 and an information sheet (March 7): What to do if you are infected with the new Coronavirus.
confirmed cases are isolated:
  At home, if the general condition permits (self-isolation)
Removal of isolation: 48 hours after the symptoms have subsided, provided that at least 10 days have passed since the onset of symptoms
  In severe cases in the hospital:
 Return home as soon as the clinical condition permits, or removal of isolation in the hospital in accordance with the criteria listed above.
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

description: On March 19, 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Health releases new self-quarantine guidelines for persons who have had contact with a sick person: If you live with, or have had an intimate relationship with, someone who has symptoms of acute respiratory disease, you must quarantine yourself at home for 10 days. Stay home for 10 days. The 10 days begin from the time the sick person is isolated. If after 10 days you have no symptoms, you can go public again. This applies if they had contact while the sick person was having symptoms and / or 24 hours before the symptoms appeared.      Monitor your health: Feeling unwell, tired, fever, feverish feeling, cough, sore throat and shortness of breath can be signs of infection with the new coronavirus, among other things.   If Symptoms Occur: Be in self-isolation and follow the instructions that apply to self-isolation.
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

description:
On March 19, 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Health releases new guidelines how to deal with symptomatic persons ( Isolation): The sharp rise in COVID-19 cases in Switzerland increases the likelihood that a person with a respiratory disease has contracted the new coronavirus. Persons who have symptoms of an acute respiratory infection, which might be caused by the new coronavirus (SARS- CoV-2) or persons whose disease has been confirmed by laboratory diagnostics do not need to be hospitalized if their general condition is good. They must be isolated at home for at least 48 hours after the symptoms have subsided, provided that at least 10 days have passed since the symptoms began.
This applies to persons with:  Cough, sore throat, shortness of breath, with or without fever, feverish feeling, muscle pain, whether tested or not.
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

description:
On April 16, 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Health releases a new information sheet for symptomatic persons ( Isolation): The increase in COVID-19 cases in Switzerland has increased the likelihood that a person with a respiratory disease has contracted the new coronavirus. You have symptoms of an acute respiratory infection and / or a sudden loss of smell and / or taste, which may be caused by the new coronavirus or the disease has been confirmed by laboratory diagnostics. If you do not have to be hospitalized as your general condition is good, you must immediately isolate yourself at home for at least 10 days.  End of isolation at home  48 hours after the symptoms have subsided, provided that at least 10 days have passed since the symptoms began. If you have had a sudden loss of smell and taste: it may take longer for the smell and taste buds to recover. The isolation can therefore be lifted if the loss of the sense of smell and / or taste is the only symptom that persists after this time.
This applies to persons with:  sudden loss of smell / taste, cough, sore throat, shortness of breath, with or without fever, feverish feeling, muscle pain, whether tested or not.
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

description: On March 16, the Government Council - Canton Zug, Switzerland,  authorises the Health Directorate to issue an immediate ban on visits to all hospitals, old people's homes, nursing homes and social institutions in Canton Zug and, if necessary, to adapt or lift it to the current situation. This decision is in force until 20 May 2020.

On May 7, the Swiss Canton of Fribourg announced that all people who tested positive for COVID-19 with mild symptoms in one of the fast-testing centres, and their persons of close contact, will have to quarantine for at least 10 days and an additional 48 hours after no symptoms are felt anymore.

description: On May 14, swiss canton Valais announces that people being tested have to quarantine until there is a result. People tested positive have to quarantine for at least 10 days and 48 hours after the symptoms disappeared. This also applies to people living in the same household with a confirmed case and people that had close contact (less than 2m, more than 15 minutes without safety measures) to a confirmed case in a time frame from 48 hours before until 10 days after the symptoms of the case appeared.

description: On May 8, the Swiss canton of Nidwalden announced that it was preparing to allow visits to hospitals and care homes under certain conditions. description:
The list of countries considered as risk countries was updated on 23 July 2020 by the Swiss Government. From July 6th on all persons who enter Switzerland and who have been in a high risk country within the last 14 days have to quarantine for 10 days. They have to report to the cantonal authorities that carry out spot checks. Contact details are provided by flights or bus services selected at random. Quarantined persons do not get loss of earnings compensation. Non - compliance can be fined.
Excepted are persons who
professionally transport people or goods across borders
whose activity is necessary the functionality of the health system, public security or some international institutions
have stayed in a risk country in the course of their professional activity in companies involved in rail, bus, ship or air transport 
have to travel to Switzerland daily or up to 5 days for occupational or medical necessities
transit passengers
just pass through Switzerland
list as of July 23th: Argentina, Armenia, Azerbaijan, Bahrain, Bolivia, Bosnia Herzegovina, Brazil, Chile, Costa Rica, Dominican Republic, Ecuador, El Salvador, Eswatini, Guatemala, Honduras, Iraq, Israel, Cabo Verde, Qatar, Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Colombia, Kosovo, Kuwait, Luxembourg, Maledives, Mexico, Moldova, Montenegro, North Macedonia, Oman, Palestine, Panama, Peru, Russia, Saudi Arabia, Serbia, South Africa, Suriname, Turks- and Caicos islands (UK), UAE, USA, Puerto Rico, American Virgin Islands
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description: On July 29, the Swiss Canton Grisons warns parents against the simple transmission of the virus. It is therefore strongly advised to keep children with symptoms such as runny nose, fever, cough, sore throat, etc. at home and to consult a doctor. Under no circumstances should children and young people take part in holiday and group offers - such as holiday camps, holiday passes or the like - if there are signs of illness. The policy aims to prevent other people from being infected.
